Fr. 3, 1, 6, § 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lauto paratu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:13 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 13 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 2, 3</bibl>; Appius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:60:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 60, 246</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:39 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 39 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:235 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 235 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:64" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:Ter. 2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. Ter. 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in litore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 31</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n7372.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cenaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud eum cenatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 14, 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 4, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7372.3" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Part. perf.</hi>: cenatus, <hi rend="ital">that has taken food</hi>, <hi rend="ital">having dined</hi> (class.): cenatus ut pransus, ut potus, ut lotus, id est confectā coenā, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 94, 14 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cenati atque appoti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid causae excogitari potest, cur te lautum voluerit, cenatum noluerit occidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 7, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 7, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:27:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 27, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:chapter=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2</bibl>. 16, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 106:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 106, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 61</bibl> (cf. Zumpt, Gram. § 633).—</sense><sense id="n7372.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: aliquid, <hi rend="ital">to make a meal of something</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to eat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dine upon</hi> (so only <usg type="style">poet.</usg> or in post-Aug. prose; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. freq. in Plaut. and Hor.): cenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coctum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alienum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aprum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 235</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">olus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 168</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulmenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 18, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patinas omasi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 15, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pisces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 8, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">septem fercula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:95" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostrea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 85</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:17:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 17, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">remedia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 1, 1, § 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:142" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 51, 72, § 142</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">olla cenanda Glyconi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:9" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7372.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum malum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 86</bibl></cit>: divorum adulteria, i. e. <hi rend="ital">represents at table</hi>, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:70" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 70</bibl> (v. the passage in connection).—* </sense><sense id="n7372.6" n="C" level="2"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">to pass in feasting or banqueting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cenatae noctes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cenomani: <entryFree id="n7373" type="main" key="Ce^no^ma_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĕnŏmāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kenomanoi/</foreign>, <sense id="n7373.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Celtic people in</hi> Gallia Cisalpina, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 19, 23, § 130</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:35:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 35, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 75</bibl>; v. Dict. of Geog.</sense></entryFree>
cenotaphium: <entryFree id="n7374" type="greek" key="ce^no^ta^phi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕnŏtăphĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kenota/fion</foreign>, <sense id="n7374.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an empty tomb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the monument of one whose body is elsewhere</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cenotaph</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:7:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 11, 7, 2</bibl> and 6; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 63, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Flav. 15, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 273" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 273</bibl> (pure Lat.: <cit><quote lang="la">tumulus inanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:304" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 304</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">or honorarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 1</bibl></cit>).</sense></entryFree>
censeo: <entryFree id="n7375" type="main" key="ce_nseo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cēnseo</orth> (on the long <sense id="n7375.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">e</hi>, v. Corss. Ausspr. 1, p. 257 sq.), ui, cēnsum (late Lat. censitum, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 11, 47</bibl> tit.; 11, 49 tit.; 11, 47, 4 al.; but not in Monum. Ancyr.; cf. Neue, Formenl. 2, 557), <itype>2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>etym. dub.; often referred to root cas-, whence carmen, camoenus; but prob. from centum, orig. centere, to hundred or number the people; cf. Fischer, Gram. 1, p. 373</etym>. </sense><sense id="n7375.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To tax</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assess</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">estimate.</hi> </sense><sense id="n7375.2" n="A" level="2"> In reference to the census (v. census). </sense><sense id="n7375.3" n="1" level="3"> Of the censor (v. censor). </sense><sense id="n7375.4" n="(a)" level="5"> Rarely <hi rend="ital">act.</hi> with <case>acc.</case> of the persons or objects assessed or rated; but usu. <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">subj. -nom.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">censores populi aevitates, suboles, familias, pecuniasque censento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:3:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">census quom sum, juratori recte rationem dedi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">censor ad quojus censionem, id est arbitrium, populus censeretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=81" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 81</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">census... indicat eum qui sit census se jam tum gessisse pro cive,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: absentīs censere jubere, P. Scipio ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:19:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 19, 16</bibl>: ne absens censeare. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:18:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 18, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub lustrum censeri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milia octoginta eo lustro civium censa dicuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:44:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 44, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">censa civium capita centum septendecim milia trecenta undeviginti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:24:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 24, 10</bibl></cit>; id. Epit. l<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:13" default="NO" valid="yes">13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:14" default="NO" valid="yes">14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">censebantur ejus aetatis lustrīs ducena quinquagena milia capitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum capitum liberorum censa essent CLII. milia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 1, 5, § 16</bibl></cit>: quid se vivere, quid in parte civium censeri, si... id obtinere universi non possint? Liv 7, 18, 5.—</sense><sense id="n7375.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With the amount at which the property was rated, in the <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: or <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesertim census equestrem Summam nummorum,</quote> <trans><tr>being assessed with the estate necessary to a Roman knight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:383" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 383</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primae classis homines quicentum et viginti quinque milia aeris ampliusve censi erant... Ceterarumque omnium classium qui minore summa aeris censebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7</bibl></cit> (6), 13, 1 sq.—Hence, capite censi, those who were assessed ac cording to their ability to labor: qui nullo <pb n="312" /> <cb n="CENS" /> aut perquam parvo aere censebantur capite censi vocabantur. Extremus autem census capite censorum aeris fuit trecentis septuaginta quinque, Jul. Paul. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:10:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 10, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 86:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 86, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:10:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 10, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:10:14" default="NO">16, 10, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:3:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:6:1" default="NO">7, 6, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in the finite verb: omnia illius (i. e. sapientis) esse dicimus, cum... capite censebitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:8:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 8, 1</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n7375.6" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> in <hi rend="ital">gerund.</hi>: censendi, censendo, ad censendum = census agendi, censui agendo, etc.: haec frequentia quae convenit ludorum censendique causā (i.e. census agendi causā, <hi rend="ital">for the sake of the census</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:18:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 18, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentio inlata apud senatum est, rem operosam... suo proprio magistratu egere... cui arbitrium formulae censendi subiceretur,</quote> <trans><tr>the scheme for taking the census</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia is censendo finis factus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:44:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 44, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civīs Romanos ad censendum ex provinciis in Italiam revocarunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:15" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetatem in censendo significare necesse est... aetas autem spectatur censendi tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:15:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 15, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7375.7" n="(d)" level="5"> Censum censere = censum agere, only in the gerundial <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud quaero, sintne illa praedia censui censendo, habeant jus civile,</quote> <trans><tr>are they subject to the census</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 32, 80</bibl></cit>: censores... edixerunt, legem censui censendo dicturos esse ut, etc., <hi rend="ital">that he would add a rule for the taking of the census</hi>, <hi rend="ital">according to which</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 14, 5</bibl>: censui censendo agri proprie appellantur qui et emi et venire jure civili possunt, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=58:5" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 58, 5</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n7375.8" n="2" level="3"> Of the assessment of the provinces under provincial officers (censores, and, under the later emperors, censitores). </sense><sense id="n7375.9" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, with the territory as subject-nom.: quinto quoque anno Sicilia tota censetur; <cit><quote lang="la">erat censa praetore Paeducaeo... quintus annus cum in te praetorem incidisset, censa denuo est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:56:section=139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 56, § 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne territorium censeatur quoties, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 11, 58</bibl></cit> (57), 4.—</sense><sense id="n7375.10" n="(b)" level="5"> The persons assessed as subject: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi (coloni) censiti atque educati natique sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 11, 48</bibl></cit> (47), 6: <cit><quote lang="la">quos in locis eisdem censitos esse constabit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 11, 48</bibl></cit> (47), 4.—With <hi rend="ital">part.</hi> as attribute: <cit><quote lang="la">rusticos censitosque servos vendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 11, 48</bibl></cit> (47), 7.—</sense><sense id="n7375.11" n="(g)" level="5"> To determine by the census: <cit><quote lang="la">cum antea per singulos viros, per binas vero mulieres capitis norma sit censa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 11, 48</bibl></cit> (47), 10: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi forte privilegio aliquo materna origo censeatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:1:1:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 1, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7375.12" n="(d)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos terras vestras levari censitione vultis, ego vero etiam aërem vestrum censere vellem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Pescen. Nig. 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7375.13" n="3" level="3"> Of the person assessed, <hi rend="ital">to value</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make a statement of one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s property in the census.</hi> </sense><sense id="n7375.14" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quā tribu ista praedia censuisti?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 32, 80</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7375.15" n="(b)" level="5"> Censeri, as <hi rend="ital">dep.</hi> with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">census es praeterea numeratae pecuniae CXXX. Census es mancipia Amyntae... Cum te audisset servos suos esse censum, constabat inter omnes, si aliena censendo Decianus sua facere posset, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 32, 80</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:2:140" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 2, 140</bibl>; v. B. 2. c.—</sense><sense id="n7375.16" n="4" level="3"> Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cēnsum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>: quorum luxuries fortunata censa peperit, i.e. <hi rend="ital">high estimates of property in the census</hi>, Cic. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 202, 23</bibl> (Fragm. vol. xi. p. 134 B. and K.).</sense><sense id="n7375.17" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things and persons in gen., <hi rend="ital">to value</hi>, <hi rend="ital">estimate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rate.</hi> </sense><sense id="n7375.18" n="1" level="3"> By a figure directly referring to the Roman census: aequo mendicus atque ille opulentissimus Censetur censu ad Acheruntem mortuus, <hi rend="ital">will be rated by an equal census</hi>, i.e. in the same class, without considering their property, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 93</bibl>: vos qui potestis ope vostrā censerier, referring to a part of the audience, <hi rend="ital">you</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who may be rated according to your intelligence</hi>, analog. to capite censi (v. I. A. 1. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. prol. 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam argumentum hoc hic censebitur,</quote> <trans><tr>will be rated</tr>, <tr>its census-class will be determined here</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. prol. 56</bibl></cit>: id in quoque optimum esse debet cui nascitur, quo censetur, <hi rend="ital">according to which he is rated</hi>, i.e. <hi rend="ital">his worth is determined</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 76:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 76, 8</bibl>.—And with two <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: quintus Phosphorus, Junonia, immo Veneris stella censetur, <hi rend="ital">is ranked as the fifth</hi>, App. de Mundo, p. 710.—</sense><sense id="n7375.19" n="2" level="3"> With direct reference to the census. </sense><sense id="n7375.20" n="a" level="4"> = aestimo, <hi rend="ital">to estimate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weigh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">value</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appreciate.</hi> </sense><sense id="n7375.21" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> of price: <cit><quote lang="la">dic ergo quanti censes?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 8, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7375.22" n="(b)" level="5"> In the <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: si censenda nobis atque aestimanda res sit, utrum tandem pluris aestimemus pecuniam Pyrrhi? etc., <hi rend="ital">if we have to weigh</hi> <cb n="CENS" /> <hi rend="ital">and estimate a thing</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:6:2:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 6, 2, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">anule... In quo censendum nil nisi dantis amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interim autem facta sola censenda dicit atque in judicium vocanda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7</bibl></cit> (6), 3, 47.—</sense><sense id="n7375.23" n="b" level="4"> = honorari, celebrari, with <hi rend="ital">de aliquo</hi>, = <hi rend="ital">for the sake of somebody</hi> (in Ovid): <cit><quote lang="la">pro quibus ut maneat, de quo censeris, amicus, Comprecor, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>the friend for the sake of whom you are celebrated</tr>, <tr>who is the cause of your renown</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:5:73" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 5, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc domui debes de quā censeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:1:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 75</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7375.24" n="c" level="4"> Censeri, <hi rend="ital">dep.</hi>, = <hi rend="ital">to distinguish</hi>, with <case>acc.</case> only once or twice in Ovid (v. I. A. 3. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">hanc semper... Est inter comites Marcia censa suas,</quote> <trans><tr>has always distinguished her</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:2:140" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 2, 140</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7375.25" n="d" level="4"> Censeri aliquā re. </sense><sense id="n7375.26" n="(a)" level="5"> = <hi rend="ital">to be appreciated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinguished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated for some quality</hi>, as if the quality were a standard determining the census, analog. to capite censeri (v. I. A. 1. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>), very freq. in post-class. writings: <cit><quote lang="la">Democritus cum divitiis censeri posset,</quote> <trans><tr>when he might have been celebrated for his wealth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 7</bibl></cit>, ext. 4: <cit><quote lang="la">Aristides quo totius Graeciae justitia censetur (quo = cujus justitiā),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 3</bibl></cit>, ext. 3 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>: te custode matronalis stola censetur ( = tuā, i.e. pudicitiae, custodiā), <hi rend="ital">the stola</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">is appreciated for thy custody</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 1</bibl> prooem.: <cit><quote lang="la">unā adhuc victoriā Carius Metius censebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ipsi quoque qui egerunt non aliis magis orationibus censeantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,003:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dial. 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: non vitibus tantum censeri Chium, sed et operibus Anthermi filiorum, <hi rend="ital">is celebrated not only for its grapes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 2, § 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et Galliae censentur hoc reditu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 1, 2, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quisquis paulo vetustior miles, hic te commilitone censetur,</quote> <trans><tr>is distinguished for the fact that you were his fellow-soldier</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:15" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multiplici variāque doctrinā censebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">felix quae tali censetur munere tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:16:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 16, 5</bibl></cit>: censetur Apona Livio suo tellus, = <hi rend="ital">for the fact that Livy was born there</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:61:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 61, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi duo longaevo censentur Nestore fundi,</quote> <trans><tr>for the fact that Nestor used them</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:6:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec laude virorum censeri contenta fuit (Iberia),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Seren. 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libri mei non aliā laude carius censentur, quam quod judicio vestro comprobantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 4, 18, 3</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n7375.27" n="(b)" level="5"> = <hi rend="ital">to be known by something</hi> (Appuleian): <cit><quote lang="la">hoc nomine censebatur jam meus dominus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen quo tu censeris aiebat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5</bibl></cit>, p. 106: pro studio bibendi quo solo censetur, either <hi rend="ital">known by</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">distinguished for</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mag. p. 499</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">globorum caelestium supremum esse eum qui inerrabili meatu censetur,</quote> <trans><tr>which is known by its unerring course</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Phil. Nat. 1, p. 582</bibl></cit>.— And, </sense><sense id="n7375.28" n="(g)" level="5"> As gram. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to be marked by some peculiarity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">according to which a word is classified</hi>: neque de armis et moeniis infitias eo quin figurā multitudinis perpetuā censeantur, <hi rend="ital">that they are marked by the form of constant plurality</hi>, i. e. that they are pluralia tantum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:8:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:20:8" default="NO">10, 20, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:13:3" default="NO">19, 13, 3</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n7375.29" n="II" level="1"> Of transactions in and by the Senate, <hi rend="ital">to judge</hi> (in the meanings II. and III. the passive voice is not in class. use, while in I. the passive voice is by far the most freq.). </sense><sense id="n7375.30" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be of opinion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to propose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to vote</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to move</hi>, referring to the votes of the senators when asked for their opinions (sententiam dicere). </sense><sense id="n7375.31" n="1" level="3"> With a (passive) <hi rend="ital">inf.-clause</hi>, denoting what should be decreed by the Senate (esse usu. omitted): rex his ferme verbis patres consulebat... Dic, inquit ei, quid censes? tum ille Puro pioque duello quaerendas (res) censeo, <hi rend="ital">I am of the opinion</hi> (<hi rend="ital">I move</hi>, <hi rend="ital">propose</hi>) <hi rend="ital">that satisfaction should be sought</hi>, etc., ancient formula ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32:11 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 32, 11 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">primum igitur acta Caesaris servanda censeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc autem tempore ita censeo decernendum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 17, 45</bibl></cit>; 5, 6, 16; 5, 12, 31; 5, 12, 34; 5, 13, 36; 5, 14, 38; 5, 19, 53; 6, 1, 2; 9, 6, 14; 11, 15, 40; 12, 7, 17; 14, 1, 1; 14, 13, 35; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Regulus's advice in the Senate, being represented as a vote: captivos in senatu reddendos non censuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:13:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 13, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 31, 111</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quare ita ego censeo... de confessis more majorum supplicium sumendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:51:8" default="NO" valid="yes">51, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:52:14" default="NO" valid="yes">52, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Appius imperio consulari rem agendam censebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:23:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 23, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut multi (senatores) delendam urbem censerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:26:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 26, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:29:7" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 29, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:40:13" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 40, 13</bibl>; 10, 12, 1; 34, 4, 20; 38, 54, 6: cum ejus diei senatus consulta aureis litteris <cb n="CENS" /> figenda in curiā censuisset, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nonnulli dedendum eum hostibus censuerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 24</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 2</bibl>. Of the emperor's vote in the Senate: <cit><quote lang="la">commutandam censuit vocem, et pro peregrinā nostratem requirendam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:71" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 71</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 55</bibl>.—And with the copula expressed (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">qui censet eos... morte esse multandos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 4, 7</bibl></cit>.—Sometimes referring to sententia as subject: <cit><quote lang="la">sententia quae censebat reddenda bona (inst. of eorum qui censebant),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 4, 3</bibl></cit>.—Sometimes with oportere for the gerundial <hi rend="ital">predic. inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibusdam censentibus (eum) Romulum appellari oportere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 7</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">pres. inf.</hi>, inst. of a gerundial: <cit><quote lang="la">hac coronā civicā L. Gellius in senatu Ciceronem consulem donari a re publicā censuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:6:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 6, 15</bibl></cit> (cf. II. B. 1. b.).—If the opinion of the senator does not refer to the chief question, but to incidental points, the <hi rend="ital">predic. inf.</hi> may have any form: <cit><quote lang="la">eas leges quas M. Antonius tulisse dicitur omnes censeo per vim et contra auspicia latas, eisque legibus populum non teneri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum magna pars senatus... cum tyrannis bellum gerendum fuisse censerent... et urbem recipi, non capi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:32:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 32, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n7375.32" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, and negatively, <hi rend="ital">ut ne</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, generally when the clause has an active predicate, but also with passives instead of the gerundial <hi rend="ital">inf.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de eā re ita censeo uti consules designati dent operam uti senatus Kal. Jan. tuto haberi possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:15:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 15, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">censeo ut iis qui in exercitu Antonii sunt, ne sit ea res fraudi, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 12, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">censebant omnes fere (senatores) ut in Italiā supplementum meis et Bibuli legionibus scriberetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cn. Pompeius (in senatu) dixit, sese... censere ut ad senatūs auctoritatem populi quoque Romani beneficium erga me adjungeretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:34:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 34, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas ob res ita censeo: eorum qui cum M. Antonio sunt, etc. ... iis fraudi ne sit quod cum M. Antonio fuerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:11:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 8, 11, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Calidius, qui censebat ut Pompeius in suas provincias proficisceretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">censuerunt quidam (senatores) ut Pannonicus, alii ut Invictus cognominaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iterum censente ut Trebianis... concederetur (of the emperor's vote in the Senate),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 31</bibl></cit>.—And an <hi rend="ital">inf.-clause</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">neu</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed ita censeo: publicandas eorum pecunias, etc.: neu quis postea de his ad senatum referat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui partem bonorum publicandam, pars ut liberis relinqueretur, censuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7375.33" n="3" level="3"> With a <hi rend="ital">subj.-clause</hi>, without ut (rare in this connection; <cit><quote lang="la">v. III. C. 3.): K. Fabius censuit... occuparent patres ipsi suum munus facere, captivum agrum plebi quam maxime aequaliter darent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:48:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 48, 2</bibl></cit>.— And ironically with regard to incidental points: vereamini censeo ne... nimis aliquid severe statuisse videamini, <hi rend="ital">I propose you should be afraid of having decreed too severe a punishment</hi> = <hi rend="ital">of course</hi>, <hi rend="ital">you will not be afraid</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 6, 13</bibl>: misereamini censeo—deliquere homines adulescentuli per ambitionem—atque etiam armatos dimittatis, <hi rend="ital">I propose that you pity them</hi>, etc., or <hi rend="ital">I advise you to be merciful</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7375.34" n="4" level="3"> Ellipt., with a gerundial clause understood: <cit><quote lang="la">dic quid censes (i. e. decernendum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 32, 11</bibl></cit>: quod ego meā sententiā censebam (i.e. decernendum), Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 5, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">senati decretum fit, sicut ille censuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 53:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 53, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas ob res ita censeo... senatui placere, etc. ( = ita decernendum censeo, etc.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:7:15:section=17 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 9, 7, 15, § 17 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 11, 25</bibl> sq.; 11, 12, 29 sq.; 14, 14, 36 sq.—</sense><sense id="n7375.35" n="5" level="3"> = sententiam dicere, <hi rend="ital">to tell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to express one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s opinion in the Senate</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n7375.36" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: Priscus Helvidius .. contra studium ejus (sc. Vitellii) censuerat, <hi rend="ital">had voted</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">had expressed an opinion against his wishes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 91</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum parum sit, in senatu breviter censere, nisi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,003:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dial. 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententias... prout libuisset perrogabat... ac si censendum magis quam adsentiendum esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">igitur Cn. Piso, quo, inquit, loco censebis, Caesar? si primus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 74</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n7375.37" n="(b)" level="5"> With adjectives in the neuter, substantively used: nec quoquam reperto (in senatu) qui... referre aut censere aliquid auderet, <hi rend="ital">who dared to express an opinion on any</hi> <pb n="313" /> <cb n="CENS" /> <hi rend="ital">thing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per dissensionem diversa censentium,</quote> <trans><tr>of the senators who expressed different opinions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 10</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n7375.38" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">interrog.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deinde ageret senatorem et censeret quid corrigi aut mutari vellet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum censeat aliquis (in senatu) quod ex parte mihi placeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 21:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 21, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n7375.39" n="B" level="2"> Of the decrees or resolutions of the Senate, = decernere, placere, <hi rend="ital">to resolve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decree.</hi> </sense><sense id="n7375.40" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.-clause.</hi> </sense><sense id="n7375.41" n="a" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">gerund</hi>, without copula (v. II. A. 1.): <cit><quote lang="la">eum, cujus supplicio senatus sollennes religiones expiandas saepe censuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:27:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 27, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eos senatus non censuit redimendos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:32:114" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 32, 114</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:4:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:6:section=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 6, § 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus Caelium ab republicā removendum censuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus censuit frequens coloniam Labicos deducendam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:47:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 47, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 24, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum bello persequendos Tusculanos patres censuissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:25:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 25, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:42:6" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 42, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:49:8" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 49, 8</bibl>; 7, 19, 7 et saep.—</sense><sense id="n7375.42" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">pres. inf. pass.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">act.</hi>, with the force of a gerundial: <cit><quote lang="la">de bonis regiis quae reddi antea censuerant ( = reddenda),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munera mitti legatis ex binis milibus aeris censuerunt (i.e. patres),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 43, 5, 8</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:44:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 44, 15</bibl> (v. 2. b.): <cit><quote lang="la">eundem jus dicere Romae... patres censuerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:12:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 12, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum senatus unum consulem, nominatimque Gnaeum Pompeium fieri censuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 26</bibl></cit>.—With both <hi rend="ital">act.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">pass. inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">censuere patres, duas provincias Hispaniam rursus fieri... et Macedoniam Illyricumque eosdem... obtinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 16, 1</bibl></cit>.—With both <hi rend="ital">pres. pass.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">gerund. inff.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ita movere senatum, ut non expectanda comitia consuli censerent, sed dictatorem... dici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 5, 14</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">And with velle: senatus verbis nuntient, velle et censere eos ab armis discedere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 21, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7375.43" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ne.</hi> </sense><sense id="n7375.44" n="a" level="4"> In the words of the Senate, according to formula: quod L. Opimius verba fecit de re publicā, de eā re ita censuerunt uti L. Opimius consul rem publicam defenderet, etc., ancient S. C. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 4, 14</bibl>: quod, etc., de eā re ita censuerunt ut M. Pomponius praetor animadverteret curaretque ut si, etc., S. C. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Rhet. 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:4:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 4, 1</bibl>.—And with gerundial <hi rend="ital">inf.-clause</hi>: quod C. Julius pontifex... de eā re ita censuerunt, uti M. Antonius consul hostiis majoribus... procuraret... Ibus uti procurasset satis habendum censuerunt, S. C. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:6:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 6, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7375.45" n="b" level="4"> As related by the historians, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam senatus censuisset, uti quicunque Galliam provinciam obtineret... Aeduos defenderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patres censuerunt uti consules provincias inter se compararent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:40:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 40, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus censuit ut domus ei... publicā impensā restitueretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 6</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with reference to the civil law,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:14:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 14, 15</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">quater.</hi>—With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatum censuisse, ne quis illo anno genitus educaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94</bibl></cit>.—And with <hi rend="ital">inf -clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">filio regis Nicomedi ex eā summā munera dari censuerunt, et ut victimae... praeberentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:44:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 44, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7375.46" n="3" level="3"> With a <hi rend="ital">subj.-clause</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">senatus consulto quo censeretur, darent operam consules, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 73:10" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 73, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7375.47" n="4" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">neutr. acc. pron.</hi> in place of a clause: <cit><quote lang="la">cum vero id senatus frequens censuisset (sc. faciendum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ite in suffragium, et quae patres censuerunt vos jubete,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quodcunque vos censueritis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quodpatres censuissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:45:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 45, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7375.48" n="5" level="3"> With accusative of a noun, or a noun as passive subject, <hi rend="ital">to decree</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vote a thing</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">nec tamen repertum nisi ut effigies principum, aras deum, templa et arcus aliaque solita... censuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aram Clementiae, aram Amicitiae, effigiesque... censuere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 74</bibl></cit>: cum censeretur clipeus auro et magnitudine insignis inter auctores eloquentiae (<hi rend="ital">to be placed among</hi>, etc.), <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 83</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7375.49" n="6" level="3"> With both <case>acc.</case> and <case>dat.</case> </sense><sense id="n7375.50" n="(a)" level="5"> The <case>dat.</case> = <hi rend="ital">against</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum Samnitibus et patres censuerunt et populus jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 12, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7375.51" n="(b)" level="5"> The <case>dat.</case> = <hi rend="ital">in behalf of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">censentur Ostorio triumphi insignia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 38</bibl></cit>.—And with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiis eorum qui supplicationes et... vestem Principi triumphalem, utque ovans urbem iniret, effigiesque ejus... censuere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n7375.52" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n7375.53" n="A" level="2"> Of the opinions and resolutions of other deliberating bodies, or <cb n="CENS" /> of their members, <hi rend="ital">to resolve</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">to be of opinion.</hi> </sense><sense id="n7375.54" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.-clause.</hi> </sense><sense id="n7375.55" n="a" level="4"> Gerundial: <cit><quote lang="la">erant qui censerent de tertiā vigiliā in castra Cornelia recedendum (council of war),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erant sententiae quae conandum omnibus modis castraque Vari oppugnanda censerent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 2, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontifices, consules, patres conscripti mihi ... pecuniā publicā aedificandam domum censuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:22:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 22, 52</bibl></cit>: nunc surgendum censeo, <hi rend="ital">I move we adjourn</hi> (in a literary meeting), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:90:367" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 90, 367</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum... pontifices solvendum religione populum censerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:23:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 23, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc has ruinas relinquendas non censerem (in an assembly of the people),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:53:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 53, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego ita censeo, legatos extemplo Romam mittendos (in the Carthaginian Senate),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:10:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 10, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante omnia Philippum et Macedonas in societatem belli... censeo deducendos esse (Hannibal in a council of war),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 7, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:36:8" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 36, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:6:22" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 6, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:8:12" default="NO">10, 8, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum septem judices cognovissent, duo censuerunt, reum exilio multandum, duo alii pecuniā, tres reliqui capite puniendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:15:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 15, 7</bibl></cit>.—And with oportere inst. of a gerundial clause (referring to duty): <cit><quote lang="la">neque sine gravi causā eum locum quem ceperant, dimitti censuerant oportere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 44</bibl></cit>.—With opus esse ( = expediency): <cit><quote lang="la">Parmenio furto, non proelio opus esse censebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:8:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 8, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7375.56" n="b" level="4"> With ordinary <hi rend="ital">pres. inf.</hi> </sense><sense id="n7375.57" n="(a)" level="5"> In place of a gerundial: <cit><quote lang="la">Antenor censet belli praecidere = praecidendam causam (in a council of war),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7375.58" n="(b)" level="5"> Denoting opinion about an existing state: <cit><quote lang="la">Hasdrubal ultimam Hispaniae oram... ignaram adhuc Romanorum esse, eoque Carthaginiensibus satis fidam censebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:20:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 20, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Parmenio non alium locum proelio aptiorem esse censebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:7:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 7, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7375.59" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">censeo ut satis diu te putes requiesse et iter reliquum conficere pergas (in a literary meeting),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:71:290" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 71, 290</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plerique censebant ut noctu iter facerent (council of war),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et nunc magnopere censere, ut unam anum ... triginta milibus talentum auri permutet (council of war),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:11:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 11, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">censeout D. Claudius ex hac die deus fiat (council of the gods),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Lud. Mort. Claud. 9:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Lud. Mort. Claud. 9, 5</bibl></cit>: antiquos audio censuisse, ne (praenomina) cui ejusdem gentis patricio inderentur, <hi rend="ital">resolved</hi> (family council), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:2:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 2, 11</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:20:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 20, 14</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n7375.60" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">subj.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc quoque arcessas censeo omnes navalís terrestrīsque copias (Hannibal in council of war),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: censeo relinquamus nebulonem hunc, eamus hinc protinus Jovi Optimo Maximo gratulatum (assembly of the people), Scipio Afric. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:18:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 18, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7375.61" n="4" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">acc. neutr.</hi> of a <hi rend="ital">pron.</hi> or <pos>adj.</pos> substantively used: <cit><quote lang="la">ego pro sententiā meā hoc censeo: quandoquidem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Lud. Mort. Claud. 11:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Lud. Mort. Claud. 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec dubitavere quin vera censeret,</quote> <trans><tr>that his opinion was correct</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:6:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 6, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7375.62" n="5" level="3"> Ellipt.: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiis quarum pars deditionem, pars eruptionem censebat (i.e. faciendam),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 77 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita uti censuerant Italici deditionem facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 26, 2</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 75</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n7375.63" n="B" level="2"> Of the orders of persons in authority (cf. II. B.). </sense><sense id="n7375.64" n="1" level="3"> Of commanders, etc., by courtesy, inst. of velle, imperare, or a direct imperative sentence. </sense><sense id="n7375.65" n="(a)" level="5"> With gerundial <hi rend="ital">inf. - clause</hi>: non tam imperavi quam censui sumptus legatis quam maxime ad legem Corneliam decernendos, <hi rend="ital">I said</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not strictly as an order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but as an opinion that</hi>, etc. (Cicero as proconsul), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 10, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7375.66" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">subj.-clause</hi>: arma quae ad me missuri eratis, iis censeo armetis milites quos vobiscum habetis, <hi rend="ital">you had better</hi>, etc., Pomp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 12</bibl>, A, 4. —</sense><sense id="n7375.67" n="2" level="3"> Of an order by the people (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">gen. populus jubet): ita id (foedus) ratum fore si populus censuisset (i. e. confirmandum esse),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 19, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7375.68" n="3" level="3"> Of the later emperors, in their ordinances (censemus = placet nobis, sancimus, imperamus, from the custom of the earlier emperors, who conveyed their commands in the form of an opinion in the senate; v. II. A. 1.).—With <hi rend="ital">inf.clause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">subj.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sex mensium spatium censemus debere servari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 11, 48</bibl></cit> (47), 7: <cit><quote lang="la">censemus ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 12, 37</bibl></cit> (38), 13: <cit><quote lang="la">censemus ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 12, 44</bibl></cit> (45), 1: censemus vindicet, remaneat, ib. <cb n="CENS" /> 11, 48 (47), 23: <cit><quote lang="la">in commune jubes si quid censesve tenendum, Primus jussa subi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 296</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n7375.69" n="C" level="2"> Of advice, given by one person to another (further development of III. A.). </sense><sense id="n7375.70" n="1" level="3"> Ante-class. formula: faciundum censeo = <hi rend="ital">I advise</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">ut-clause</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">quid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sic</hi>, etc.: censeo faciundum ut quadringentos aliquos milites ad verrucam illam ire jubeas, etc., <hi rend="ital">I advise you to order</hi>, etc., Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:7:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 7, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego Tiresiam... consulam, Quid faciundum censeat,</quote> <trans><tr>consult Tiresias as to what he advises</tr>, <tr>for his advice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulam hanc rem amicos quid faciundum censeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 4, 3, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 1, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic faciundum censeo: Da isti cistellam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego sic faciundum censeo: me honestiu'st Quam te, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 4, 2, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 91</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sane faciundum censeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 4, 2, 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7375.71" n="2" level="3"> With ordinary gerundial <hi rend="ital">inf.-clauses</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">narrandum ego istuc militi censebo,</quote> <trans><tr>I advise you to let the soldier know that</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 4, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exorando sumendam operam censeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid nunc consili captandum censes?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 2, 91</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 5, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 115</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">idem tibi censeo faciendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:10:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 10, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos quidem tibi studiose et diligenter tractandos magno opere censeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:28:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 28, 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 28, 2</bibl>.—Sometimes by aequum censere with an <hi rend="ital">inf.-clause</hi> (in the comic poets): <cit><quote lang="la">amicos consulam quo me modo Suspendere aequom censeant potissumum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:5:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 5, 50</bibl></cit>: qui homo cum animo... depugnat suo, Utrum ita se esse mavelit ut eum animus aequom censeat, An ita potius ut parentes ... velint i. e. <hi rend="ital">as his mind prompts him</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 29</bibl>; cf. E. 1. b. 8.—</sense><sense id="n7375.72" n="3" level="3"> With a <hi rend="ital">subj.clause</hi> (so esp. with censeo in 1<hi rend="ital">st pers.</hi>): censen' hominem interrogem? <hi rend="ital">do you advise me to ask the man?</hi> etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 4, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu, si videbitur, ita censeo facias ut... supersedeas hoc labore itineris (cf.: faciundum censeo ut, 1. supra),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immo plane, inquam, Brute, legas (Gracchum) censeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:33:125" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 33, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu, si forte quid erit molestiae te ad Crassum et Calidium conferas censeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu, censeo, tamen adhibeas Vettium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae disputari de amicitiā possunt, ab iis censeo petatis qui ista profitentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:5:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 5, 17</bibl></cit>: tu, censeo, Luceriam venias: nusquam eris tutius, Pomp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 11</bibl>, A: <cit><quote lang="la">censeo Viā Appiā iter facias, et celeriter Brundusium venias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 11</bibl></cit>, C: ad Caesarem mittas censeo, et ab eo hoc petas, Anton. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 10, 10, 2</bibl>: sed hos tamen numeros censeo videas <foreign lang="greek">o(dou= pa/rergon</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:20:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 20, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam scit uterque, libens censebo exerceat artem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 44</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 7, 17</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:18:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 18, 3</bibl>, quoted III. A. 3.).—Of an advice given to an adversary, with irony: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera si qua putes te occultius facere posse... magnopere censeo desistas,</quote> <trans><tr>I strongly advise you to give up that idea</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:68:section=174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 68, § 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed tu, Acci, consideres censeo diligenter, utrum censorum judicium grave esse velis an Egnatii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:48:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 48, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postulant ut excipiantur haec inexplicabilia. Tribunum censeant: aliquem adeant: a me... numquam impetrabunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 30, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi quaeratis socios censeo, ubi Saguntina clades ignota est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:19:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 19, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solvas censeo, Sexte, creditori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:13:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 13, 2</bibl></cit>.—And in jest: <cit><quote lang="la">Treviros vites censeo, audio capitalīs esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi Plebei fuerunt, quos contemnas censeo... quā re ad patres censeo revertare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 21, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vites censeo porticum Philippi: si te viderit Hercules, peristi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:49:13" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 49, 13</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:ib. 11:99:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 99, 8</bibl>; 12, 61, 7.—For ironical senatorial advice, by which the contrary is meant, v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 6, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 26</bibl>, quoted II. A. 3.—</sense><sense id="n7375.73" n="4" level="3"> With an <hi rend="ital">ut-clause</hi> (with monere; <cit><quote lang="la">very rare): illud tamen vel tu me monuisse vel censuisse puta... ut tu quoque animum inducas, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 8, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7375.74" n="5" level="3"> With a clause understood: quo me vortam nescio: <hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi> Si deos salutas, dextrovorsum censeo (i.e. id facias or faciundum censeo), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 70</bibl>: quo redeam? <hi rend="ital">Pe.</hi> Equidem ad phrygionem censeo (i. e. redeas), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 4, 2, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid nunc censes, Chrysale? (i. e. faciundum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita faciam ut frater censuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi igitur hoc censeo (i. e. faciendum): latendum tantisper ibidem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: tu <pb n="314" /> <cb n="CENS" /> potes Kalendis spectare gladiatores, et ita censeo, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid censes igitur? Ecquidnam est tui consilii ad? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: quid igitur censet (sapientia)? <hi rend="ital">What is wisdom</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s advice?</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 3, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribi quid placeat, quid censeas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 19,4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibitur igitur, et ita quidem ut censes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disce, docendus adhuc, quae censet amiculus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n7375.75" n="D" level="2"> Of opinions and views on general questions, <hi rend="ital">to be of opinion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">think</hi>, <hi rend="ital">believe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hold</hi> (cf.: statuo, existimo, puto, aio, dico; freq. in class. prose; very rare in post-class. writers except Gellius; never with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">subj.-clause</hi>). </sense><sense id="n7375.76" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Plato mundum esse factum censet a deo sempiternum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 37, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cyrenaici non omni malo aegritudinem effici censent, sed insperato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:13:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 13, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Hieronymus) censet summum bonum esse sine ullā molestiā vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:5:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aristoteles eos qui valetudinis causā furerent, censebat habere aliquid in animis praesagiens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:38:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 38, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pythagoras censuit animum esse per naturam rerum omnem intentum et commeantem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 11, 27</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 11, 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 42, 131</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:6:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 6, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 15, 49</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 19, 64</bibl>; 3, 21, 70; 4, 7, 17; 5, 7, 17; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 12, 29</bibl>; 1, 13, 35 and 37; 1, 43, 120; 1, 44, 121; 2, 22, 57; 2, 16, 44; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:12:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 12, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:13:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 13, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:9:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 9, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 10, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 30, 72</bibl>; 1, 45, 108; 3, 5, 11; 3, 22, 52; 4, 7, 14; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:25:88" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 25, 88</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Plato in civitate communīs esse mulieres censuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:2:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 2, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:5:2" default="NO">14, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:1:4" default="NO">18, 1, 4</bibl>; 19, 12, 6.—If the opinion refers to what should be observed, oportere or debere is used, or a gerundial predicate with esse (so in Cic., but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:15:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 15, 3</bibl>, without esse): <cit><quote lang="la">oportere delubra esse in urbibus censeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:10:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 10, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Varro aeditumum dici oportere censet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:10:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 10, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:5:2" default="NO">14, 5, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with debere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:5:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 17, 5, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:8:4" default="NO">13, 8, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cyrenaici... virtutem censuerunt ob eam rem esse laudandam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:33:116" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 33, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Ennius) non censet lugendam esse mortem quam immortalitas consequatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:20:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 20, 73</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7375.77" n="2" level="3"> An <hi rend="ital">inf.-clause</hi> understood: <cit><quote lang="la">(dissensio est), a quibus temporibus scribendi capiatur initium. Ego enim ab ultimis censeo (i. e. exordiendum esse),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:3:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si, Mimnermus uti censet, sine amore jocisque Nil est jucundum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic enim censuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:33:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 33, 117</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7375.78" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">neutr. acc.</hi> of a <hi rend="ital">pron.</hi>: hoc amplius censeo, <hi rend="ital">in addition to the opinions mentioned I hold</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 3:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 3, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullo (medico) idem censente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 5, § 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7375.79" n="4" level="3"> With a <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aesopus quae utilia... erant, non severe neque imperiose praecepit et censuit,</quote> <trans><tr>he imparted his teachings and views</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:29:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 29, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7375.80" n="5" level="3"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">non adligo me ad unum aliquem ex Stoicis proceribus. Est et mihi censendi jus,</quote> <trans><tr>the right to impart my opinions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 3:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 3, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n7375.81" n="E" level="2"> In gen., = arbitror, puto, existimo, judico (cf.: idem enim valet censere et arbitrari, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 519, 29</bibl>: censere nunc significat putare, nunc suadere, nunc decernere, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=54:11" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 54, 11</bibl> Müll.). </sense><sense id="n7375.82" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To judge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">think</hi>, <hi rend="ital">believe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suppose</hi> (freq. in ante-class. writings; very rare in Cic. except in the particular meanings, a.—ironically—and d.; always with <hi rend="ital">inf.-clause</hi> expressed or understood). </sense><sense id="n7375.83" n="a" level="4"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">atque ego censui abs te posse hoc me impetrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:12 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 12 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis jam delusam censeo: rem, ut est, nunc eloquamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 3, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam si honeste censeam te facere posse, suadeam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque ego hac noctem longiorem me vidisse censeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saluti quod tibi esse censeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 1, 35</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:4:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 4, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 127</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 75</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 2, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 53</bibl>;
