<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 2, 2, 13</bibl>: aut domino, cujum id censebis esse, reddes, Cincius, Re Mil. l. iii., de ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:4:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo namque omnem belli molem inclinaturam censebant (consules),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:32:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 32, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec facturum aequa Samnitium populum censebant, si... oppugnarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:31:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 31, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaeso ut ea quae dicam non a militibus imperatori dicta censeas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 13, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at illa purgare se, quod quae utilia esse censebat ... suasisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:3:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: Alexander, tam memorabili victoriā laetus, quā sibi Orientis<cb n="CENS" />  fines apertos esse censebat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 1, 1</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:8:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 8, 22</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7375.84" n="b" level="4"> With reference to an erroneous opinion, <hi rend="ital">to imagine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suppose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">falsely believe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">censebam me effugisse a vitā maritumā Ne navigarem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes eum (sc. Jovem) esse (Amphitruonem) censent servi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 122:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. prol. 122, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam hic ero, quom illic censebis esse me,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardere censui aedes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego hunc censebam esse te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 9, 13</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 5, 2, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 1, 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 3, 3, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 9, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 54</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1, 60</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 4, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 4, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 7, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 4, 2, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 72</bibl> et saep.: censuit se regem Porsenam occidere, Cass. Hem. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 4, 88</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ipsa saxa magis sensu omni vacabant quam ille... cui se hic cruciatum censet optare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:44:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 44, 107</bibl></cit>.—And ironically: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi forte Diagoram aut Theodorum... censes superstitiosos fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:42:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 42, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi forte etiam illi Semproniano senatus consulto me censes adfuisse, qui ne Romae quidem fui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 29, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neminem me fortiorem esse censebam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:14:42" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 14, 42</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7375.85" n="c" level="4"> Referring to what should take place. </sense><sense id="n7375.86" n="(a)" level="5"> With gerundial <hi rend="ital">inf.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">navis praedatoria, Abs quā cavendum nobis sane censeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 2, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">soli gerundum censeo morem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque vendundam censeo Quae libera est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 39</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 53</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 8, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 2, 4, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceterum ei qui consilium adferret opem quoque in eam rem adferendam censebant esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:11:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 11, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7375.87" n="(b)" level="5"> With oportere, debere, or an ordinary <hi rend="ital">inf.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">solam illi me soli censeo esse oportere obedientem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus declaraveram, quo te animo censerem esse oportere, et quid tibi faciendum arbitrarer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rursus interrogatus quid ipse victorem statuere debere censeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:14:43" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 14, 43</bibl></cit>: impudens postulatio visa est, censere... ipsos id (bellum) advertere in se, agrosque suos pro alienis populandos obicere, <hi rend="ital">to entertain the idea that they should direct that war against themselves and their own lands</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 20, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">munere eum fungi prioris censet amici = eum fungi oportere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae nos quoque sustinere censebat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 253</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7375.88" n="(g)" level="5"> By aequum censere with ordinary <hi rend="ital">inf.clause</hi>, expressed or understood, either = <hi rend="ital">it is fair</hi> (<hi rend="ital">right</hi>) <hi rend="ital">to do something</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">something ought</hi> or <hi rend="ital">should be done</hi> (so very freq. in the comic poets and Livy; rare in other writers): non ego istunc me potius quam te metuere aequom censeo, <hi rend="ital">I do not think it right to fear him</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 51</bibl>: quid me aequom censes pro illā tibi dare? <hi rend="ital">What do you think I should give as a fair price?</hi> etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 3, 76</bibl>: meum animum tibi servitutem servire aequom censui, <hi rend="ital">I thought it my duty that my mind should</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 27</bibl>: ecquis est tandem qui vestrorum... aequom censeat poenas dare ob eam rem quod arguatur male facere voluisse? Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6</bibl> (7), 3, 36: <cit><quote lang="la">quis aequum censeret... receptos in fidem non defendi?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 19, 5</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:37:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 37, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:32:6" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 32, 6</bibl>.—And without emphasis upon the idea of fairness or right: <cit><quote lang="la">si sunt ita ut ego aequom censeo,</quote> <trans><tr>as I think they ought to be</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 55</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 87</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 4, 1, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 1, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui aequom esse censeant, nos jam a pueris ilico nasci senes,</quote> <trans><tr>who believe that we should be born as old men right from childhood</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 5, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 4, 3, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui aequom censeant rem perniciosam utili praeponi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 14, 22</bibl></cit>: (tribuni) intercedebant; <cit><quote lang="la">senatum quaerere de pecuniā non relatā in publicum... aequum censebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:54:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 54, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cives civibus parcere aequum censebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Thras. 2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Thras. 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7375.89" n="d" level="4"> Very freq., esp. in Cic., when a question, rhetorical or real, is addressed to a second person, often referring to erroneous opinions: <cit><quote lang="la">an fores censebas nobis publicitus praeberier?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:4:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 4, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clanculum istaec te flagitia facere censebas potesse?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 4, 2, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hicine nos habitare censes?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes cinaedos esse censes, tu quia es?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 3, 2, 48</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 4, 78</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:6:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 6, 41</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2</bibl>. 82; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 66</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 74</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 5, 25</bibl>: <cb n="CENS" /> continuo dari Tibi verba censes? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 2, 25</bibl>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 13</bibl>; 4, 4, 55; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 4, 3, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 4, 1, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:6:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 6, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adeone me delirare censes ut ista esse credam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:6:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam cum in Graeco sermone haec... non videbantur, quid censes in Latino fore?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:4:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid igitur censes? Apim illum nonne deum videri Aegyptiis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:29:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 29, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis haec neget esse utilia? quem censes?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:26:99" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 26, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an censes me tantos labores... suscepturum fuisse, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:23:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 23, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an vos Hirtium pacem velle censetis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 12, 4, 9</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:50:186" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 50, 186</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">85, 294</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:5:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 5, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 13, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:10:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 10, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:8:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 8, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 28, 78</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 44, 122</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:10:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 10, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:16:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 16, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 6, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 4, 14</bibl>; 11, 1, 3; 11, 5, 10; 12, 3, 7; 12, 6, 13; 12, 8, 21; 12, 9, 22; 13, 2, 4; 14, 4, 10; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 11, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid censes munera terrae?... quo spectanda modo, quo sensu credis et ore?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 5</bibl></cit> sqq.; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:973" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 973</bibl> (with <hi rend="ital">obj.inf.</hi>).—With conditional period inst. of an <hi rend="ital">inf.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">num censes faceret, filium nisi sciret eadem haec velle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 3, 46</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Sometimes censemus? is used in the same way as censes?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:7:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 7, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 9, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7375.90" n="e" level="4"> With an <hi rend="ital">inf.clause</hi> understood: itane tu censes? <hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi> Quid ego ni ita censeam? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 3, 27</bibl>: quid ergo censes? <hi rend="ital">Tr.</hi> Quod rogas, Censeo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:8:7 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 8, 7 sq.</bibl>: quid illum censes? (i. e. eo loco facere?) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 2, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid illas censes? (i. e. posse dicere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 4, 5, 22</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 3, 21</bibl>.—So, very freq. in the comic poets, censeo, <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, as an approving answer; also sic censeo, istuc censeo, ita censeo (Cic.) to be variously rendered: ego divinam rem intus faciam... <hi rend="ital">So.</hi> Censeo, <hi rend="ital">that will be right!</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 3, 11</bibl>: auscultemus quid agat: <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Sane censeo, <hi rend="ital">so we will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indeed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 2, 2, 29</bibl>: quid si recenti re aedis pultem? <hi rend="ital">Ad.</hi> Censeo, <hi rend="ital">do so!</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 4, 18</bibl>: quin eloquamur? <hi rend="ital">Ag.</hi> Censeo, hercle, patrue, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 4, 93</bibl>: patri etiam gratulabor? <hi rend="ital">Tr.</hi> Censeo, <hi rend="ital">I think so</hi> (and after answering several questions with censeo): etiamne complectar ejus patrem? <hi rend="ital">Tr.</hi> Non censeo. <hi rend="ital">Pl.</hi> Nunc non censet quom volo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 8, 6</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 4, 3, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 27</bibl>: male habeas! <hi rend="ital">Mu.</hi> Sic censeo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 4, 1, 11</bibl>: aliquem arripiamus, etc.: <hi rend="ital">Ly.</hi> Hem, istuc censeo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 3, 19</bibl> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">prorsus ita censeo, referring to general questions, as in D.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:10:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 10, 23</bibl></cit>); <cit><quote lang="la">once similarly censeas: Quid gravare? censeas!</quote> <trans><tr>Say yes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 3, 2, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7375.91" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To resolve</hi>, as a merely mental act, with gerundial <hi rend="ital">inf.-clause</hi> (rare; cf. II. B.): quibus rebus cognitis, Caesar maturandum sibi censuit, <hi rend="ital">resolved to hasten</hi>, lit., <hi rend="ital">thought he must hasten</hi> ( = statuit, existimavit), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 56 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">censuimus igitur amplius quaerendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:14:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 14, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7375.92" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To consider</hi>, i. e. after carefully weighing the circumstances, with <hi rend="ital">inf.-clause</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">sed cum censerem... me et periculum vitare posse, et temperatius dicere... ea causa mihi in Asiam proficiscendi fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:91:314" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 91, 314</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7375.93" n="4" level="3"> = pu tare, habere, judicare, <hi rend="ital">to consider as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hold</hi>, with two <case>acc.</case>, or <hi rend="ital">inf.-clause.</hi> </sense><sense id="n7375.94" n="a" level="4"> With double <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quom dispicias tristem, frugi censeas (i.e. eum),</quote> <trans><tr>you would consider him thrifty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 2</bibl></cit>. 32: <cit><quote lang="la">auxilio vos dignos censet senatus,</quote> <trans><tr>considers you worthy of help</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:31:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 31, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">has... indagines cuppediarum majore detestatione dignas censebimus si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7</bibl></cit> (6), 16, 6: cum Priscum nobilitas hostem patriae censuisset, <hi rend="ital">judged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">declared him the enemy</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 29:4" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 29, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7375.95" n="b" level="4"> In the <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> with <case>nom.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, = haberi (in Manil. and Gell.): <cit><quote lang="la">praeter illas unam et viginti (comoedias) quae consensu omnium Plauti esse censebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:3:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae terrenā censentur sidera sorte (i. e. esse),</quote> <trans><tr>are considered as being of the terrestrial kind</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 2, 226</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 293</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 653</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 667</bibl>; 3, 96; so, sub aliquo censeri, <hi rend="ital">to be considered as being under one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s influence</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 246</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 705</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 598</bibl> (with <hi rend="ital">per</hi>).— </sense><sense id="n7375.96" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To wish</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">subj.-clause</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ne</hi> (in App.): <cit><quote lang="la">de comā pretiosi velleris floccum mihi confestim adferas censeo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6</bibl></cit>. <pb n="315" /> <cb n="CENS" /> p. 117: <cit><quote lang="la">censeo ne ulla cura os percolat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mag. p. 411</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n7376" type="hapax" key="censeo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">censeo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, = succenseo, <sense id="n7376.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be angry</hi>: ne vobis censeam, si, etc., Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 267, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
censio: <entryFree id="n7377" type="main" key="ce_nsi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cēnsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. censeo</etym> (only anteand post-class.). <sense id="n7377.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An estimating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">taxing</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">censor</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s estimating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appraising</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">capitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:10:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 10, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Servi Tulli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:28:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 28, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=81" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 81</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=65:9" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 65, 9</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n7377.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The punishment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chastisement</hi> (<hi rend="ital">of the censor</hi>); cf.: censionem facere dicebatur censor, quom multam equiti irrogabat, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=54:5" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 54, 5</bibl> Müll.—Hence, in the lang. of comedy: <cit><quote lang="la">censio bubula,</quote> <trans><tr>a scourging</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 1, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7377.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A severe opinion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">judgment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de nostris epistulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 1:3" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Abrah. 2, 1, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7377.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The expression of opinion</hi>: adsum equidem, ne censionem semper facias, <hi rend="ital">that you be not forever saying</hi> censeo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 8, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
censitio: <entryFree id="n7378" type="main" key="censi_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">censītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. censeo, censītus</etym>. * <sense id="n7378.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A taxing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tax</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tribute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">levare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Pescenn. Nigr. 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n7378.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A declaration of the will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a command</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vespasiani censitione et jussu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Colon. p. 146" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Colon. p. 146</bibl></cit> Goes.</sense></entryFree>
censitor: <entryFree id="n7379" type="main" key="censi_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">censītor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, in the provinces, <sense id="n7379.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the magistrate presiding over the rating of citizens</hi> ( = censor), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:1:30" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 1, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:15:4" default="NO">50, 15, 4</bibl>; Cod. Th. 6, 3, 2; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 208 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
censitus: <entryFree id="n7380" type="main" key="censi_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">censītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, = census, v. 1. censeo.</entryFree>
censor: <entryFree id="n7381" type="main" key="censor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">censor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. censeo; cf. also Umbr. censtur; Sanscr. canster, leader, governor</etym>, <sense id="n7381.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a censor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a Roman magistrate</hi>, of whom there were two, chosen orig. every five, and afterwards every one and a half years, who at first only had the charge of the Roman people and their property, in respect to their division according to rank or circumstances; but gradually came to the exercise of the office of censor of morals and conduct, and punished the moral or political crimes of those of higher rank by consigning them to a lower order (senatu movebant, equiti equum adimebant, civem tribu movebant, in aerarios referebant, aerarium faciebant, etc.; cf aerarius, A. b., which punishment of the censor, whether inflicted in consequence of a judicium turpe, acc. to a tribunal authorized therefor, or in accordance with the decision of the censors themselves, was called animadversio censoria or ignominia = <foreign lang="greek">a)timi/a</foreign>). They also, even from the most ancient times, let out the tolls, public saltworks, the building and repairing of public works, the procuring of victims for public sacrifice, etc.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:3:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 8, 7</bibl>; Nieb. Röm. Gesch. 2, p. 446 sq.; <cit><quote lang="la">Dict. of Antiq., art. censor.—Also in the Roman colonies and provinces there were censors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:53:section=131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 53, § 131</bibl></cit>; and <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 56</bibl>, § <cit><quote lang="la">138 sq.: censor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:14:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 14, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:15:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 15, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:37:7" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 37, 7</bibl> (in later Lat. called censitor, q. v.).—</sense><sense id="n7381.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a rigid judge of morals</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a censurer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">critic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pertristis quidam patruus, censor, magister,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castigator censorque minorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tabulis animum censoris sumet honesti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 110</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:12:25" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 12, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">factorum dictorumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 20:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 20, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servis erilis imperii non censor est, sed minister,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Exc. Contr. 3:9:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Exc. Contr. 3, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sallustius gravissimus alienae luxuriae objurgator et censor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 9, 9</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita fides prompta dura sui censor est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 10, 83</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
censorinus: <entryFree id="n7382" type="main" key="Censo_ri_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Censōrīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n7382.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A cognomen in the</hi> gens Marcia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:90:311 al" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 90, 311 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n7382.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A grammarian of the third century</hi>, whose work, De Die Natali, is extant.</sense></entryFree>
censorius: <entryFree id="n7383" type="main" key="censo_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">censōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>censor</etym>, <sense id="n7383.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the censor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">censorial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulae,</quote> <trans><tr>the lists of the censor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex,</quote> <trans><tr>a contract for leasing buildings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:55:section=143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 55, § 143</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">public revenues</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 5, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:12:section=35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 12, § 35</bibl> (the same: <cit><quote lang="la">locatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:6:section=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 6, § 12</bibl></cit>); sometimes, also, <hi rend="ital">the order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decisions of the censor</hi> (concerning the divisions of the people, taxes, public buildings, etc.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 5, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">edictum (de rhetoribus Latinis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Rhet. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">severitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:46:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 46, 129</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 5, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animadversio atque auctoritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:42:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 42, 117</bibl></cit> and 119; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">animadversio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 46, 129</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nota,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:18:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 18, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:32" default="NO">5, 13, 32</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:46:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 46, 129</bibl>: censoriae severitatis nota): <cb n="CENT" /> opus, <hi rend="ital">a fault</hi> or <hi rend="ital">crime which was followed by the punishment of the censor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:90:367" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 90, 367</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:12:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 12, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:7:8" default="NO">14, 7, 8</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which also, probrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 3, 3, § 10</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">but censorium opus,</quote> <trans><tr>the punishment inflicted by the censor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12</bibl></cit>, praef. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <trans><tr>any one who had been censor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:90:367" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 90, 367</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author> Censorius, Quint. 12, 1, 35</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7383.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">rigid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">severe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:15:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 15, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:80:12" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 80, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
censualis: <entryFree id="n7384" type="main" key="censu^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">censŭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>census</etym>, <sense id="n7384.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of or pertaining to a census</hi> (in late and jurid. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">forma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:15:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 15, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincula, ib.: professiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:4:18" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 50, 4, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7384.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">censŭ-āles</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n7384.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Those who make out the censor</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s lists</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Gord. 12</bibl>; Cod. Th. 8, tit. 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 10:43" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 10, 43</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7384.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The censor</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s lists</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
censum: <entryFree id="n7385" type="main" key="censum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">censum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>1. censeo</etym>, = 2. census, II. c., <sense id="n7385.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wealth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">riches</hi>, Cic. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 202, 23</bibl> (IV. 2, p. 456 Orell.).</sense></entryFree>
censura: <entryFree id="n7386" type="main" key="censu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">censūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>censor</etym>. <sense id="n7386.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The office of censor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">censorship</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 24, 3</bibl> sq.; 9, 34, 16 sq.; 9, 46, 10 et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:30:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 30, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 4, 5, § 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:647" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 647</bibl> et saep.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">dat veniam corvis, vexat censura columbas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:63" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 63</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7386.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n7386.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A judgment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opinion</hi>, in gen. (prob. not ante-Aug.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 362</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:36:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 36, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">culinarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 54, 79, § 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cachinni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:31" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de omni scripto (Senecae) judicium censuramque facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:2:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 2, 2</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n7386.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A severe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rigid judgment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">severity</hi>: parentis, Treb. Gall. 3; <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> M. Aur. 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
census: <entryFree id="n7387" type="main" key="census1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">census</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from 1. censeo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n7388" type="main" key="census2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">census</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. censeo</etym>. <sense id="n7388.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A registering and rating of Roman citizens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">property</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">a census;</hi> cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:42:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 42, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 15</bibl>, and the compendiums referred to under censor: <cit><quote lang="la">habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:53:section=131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 53, § 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 22, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:46:8" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 46, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:28:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 28, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">censere, cf. censeo: censu prohibere,</quote> <trans><tr>to refuse one admittance into the lists of citizens</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:47:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 47, 101</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">censu excludere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 15, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manumissio censu,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>when a slave was enrolled in the census at the request of his master</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:5:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n7388.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n7388.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The register of the census</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the censor</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s lists</hi>, P. Afr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:11:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 11, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 5, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:32:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 32, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:44:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 44, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:15:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 15, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:3:10" default="NO">22, 3, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7388.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The registered property of Roman citizens</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">census senatorum (800,000 sesterces),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">census equester (400,000 sesterces),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 40</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:326" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 326</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7388.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Wealth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">riches</hi>, <hi rend="ital">property</hi>, <hi rend="ital">possessions</hi>, in gen. ( = divitiae, opes): <cit><quote lang="la">homo egens, sine censu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 22, 52</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:15:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 15, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:324" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 324</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:217" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 217</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:588" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 3, 588</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 846</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14</bibl>, prooem. § 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">44 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exiguus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 7, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opimo onerare digitos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 1, 6, § 22</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, = pretium, munera, <hi rend="ital">rich presents</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gifts</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:739" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 739</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7388.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: censu Tullius oris (<hi rend="ital">by eloquence</hi>) Emeritus caelum, <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 1, 792</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 71</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
centaureum: <entryFree id="n7389" type="greek" key="centaure_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">centaurēum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ĭon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (access. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">centaurĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 34</bibl> and 35), = <foreign lang="greek">kentau/reion</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">kentau/rion</foreign>, <sense id="n7389.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">centaury</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a plant of two kinds</hi>: majus, Centaurea centaurium, Linn.; and minus, Gentiana centaurium, id.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 6, 30, § 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:401" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 401</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thessala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:918" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 918</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:270" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 270</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
centaureus: <entryFree id="n7390" type="main" key="Centaure_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Centaurēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Centaurus</etym>, <sense id="n7390.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to a Centaur</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of the Centaurs</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rixa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:18:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 18, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
centauricus: <entryFree id="n7391" type="main" key="Centauri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Centaurĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n7391.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to a Centaur</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lustra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 266</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
centaurion: <entryFree id="n7392" type="main" key="centaurion"><orth extent="full" lang="la">centaurion</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. centaureum.</entryFree>
centauris: <entryFree id="n7393" type="greek" key="centauris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">centauris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kentauri/s</foreign>, <sense id="n7393.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a species of</hi> centaureum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 6, 32, § 69</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
centauromachia: <entryFree id="n7394" type="main" key="Centauro^ma^chi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Centaurŏmăchĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n7394.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fictitious name of a part of Thessaly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 75</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
centaurus: <entryFree id="n7395" type="main" key="Centaurus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Centaurus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ke/ntauros</foreign>, <sense id="n7395.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Centaur; the Centaurs were wild people in the mountains of Thessaly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who fought on horseback;</hi> acc. to the fable, monsters in Thessaly of a double form (the upper parts human, the lower those of a horse), sons of Ixion and of a cloud in the form of Juno <cb n="CENT" /> (hence nubigenae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:674" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 674</bibl>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:876" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 876</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:889" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 889</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 191</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 219</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:456" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 456</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:675" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 675</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:15 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 15 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. 1:13" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. 1, 13</bibl> (21): <cit><quote lang="la">nobilis, i. e. Chiron,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:13:11" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 13, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">bimembris, v. Lapithae.—As figure-head of a ship,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 195</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7395.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A constellation in the southern heavens</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:38" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 2, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:3:37" default="NO">3, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:203 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 203 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 1, 408</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7395.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a ship</hi> (hence, sc. navis, <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">magna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 122</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
centenarius: <entryFree id="n7396" type="main" key="cente_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">centēnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>centeni</etym>, <sense id="n7396.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">consisting of a hundred</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relating to a hundred</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=86" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 86</bibl></cit> Müll., p. 26 Bip.: <cit><quote lang="la">grex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:3:6:6" default="NO">3, 6, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pondera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 20, 19, § 83</bibl></cit>: ballistae, <hi rend="ital">throwing stones weighing a hundred pounds</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 555, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fistula,</quote> <trans><tr>of a hundred inches</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 29" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:62" default="NO">62</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Aug. 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">basilicae,</quote> <trans><tr>a hundred feet long</tr>.</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Gord. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rosae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>hundred-leaved</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cor. Mil. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertus,</quote> <trans><tr>possessed of a hundred thousand sesterces</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:14:16" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 37, 14, 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 3:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 3, 8</bibl> 2: cenae, <hi rend="ital">of a hundred</hi> asses, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=54" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 54</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 7</bibl> (but in Ann. 2, p. 97 is to be read centimanos, acc. to Lachm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2, p. 107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, p. 107</bibl>). —</sense><sense id="n7396.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Centēnārĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = centuriones, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
centeni: <entryFree id="n7397" type="main" key="cente_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">centēni</orth>, <itype>ae, a</itype> (among the poets and in post-class. prose also in <number>sing.</number>; cf.: bini, terni, etc.; <sense id="n7397.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> centenūm, like binūm, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:163 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 49, 50, § 163 sq.</bibl> al.), <hi rend="ital">num. distrib.</hi> [centum], <hi rend="ital">a hundred each</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a hundred</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illos centeni quemque sequuntur juvenes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">centum bracchia Centenaeque manus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 566</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">centenos sestertios militibus est pollicitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Alex. 48" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. Alex. 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">centena sestertia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:6:3:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 6, 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicies centena milia passuum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 13</bibl></cit>.—In <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 207</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:45" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:4:43" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 4, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:6" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7397.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">centēna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. dignitas). = centurionatus, <hi rend="ital">a dignity in the imperial court</hi>, Cod. Th. 10, 7, 1 al.<orth extent="full" lang="la">—</orth>;</sense><sense id="n7397.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">centēnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of grain</hi>, = secale (because it bears a hundredfold), Edict. Diocl. p. 27; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 17, 3, 12</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 16, 40, § 141</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
centenionalis: <entryFree id="n7398" type="main" key="cente_ni^o_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">centēnĭōnālis nummus</orth>, <sense id="n7398.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small coin</hi>, Cod. Th. 9, 23, 1 and 2.</sense></entryFree>
centesimo: <entryFree id="n7399" type="hapax" key="cente_si^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">centēsĭmo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>centesimus</etym>, <sense id="n7399.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to take out every hundredth</hi> for punishment, <hi rend="ital">to centesimate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Macr. 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
centesimus: <entryFree id="n7400" type="main" key="cente_si^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">centēsĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n7400.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num. ordin.</hi> [centum], <hi rend="ital">the hundredth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lux ab interitu Clodii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:35:98 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 35, 98 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n7400.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">centēsĭma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. pars), <hi rend="ital">the hundredth part of a thing</hi>, as a revenue, tax, a percentage: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum venalium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 78</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 42</bibl>.—And of interest, 1 per cent. monthly; <cit><quote lang="la">therefore, acc. to our manner of computing interest, 12 per cent. annually,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:11 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 21, 11 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">binae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:70:section=165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 70, § 165</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7400.2" n="II" level="1"> For centuplex, <hi rend="ital">a hundredfold</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frux,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 4, 3, § 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 16, 40, § 141</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:44:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 44, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
centiceps: <entryFree id="n7401" type="hapax" key="centi^ceps"><orth extent="full" lang="la">centĭceps</orth>, <itype>cĭpĭtis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>centum-caput</etym>, <sense id="n7401.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hundred-headed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">belua, i. e. Cerberus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:13:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 13, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
centiens: <entryFree id="n7402" type="main" key="centiens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">centiens</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">centies</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>centum</etym>, <sense id="n7402.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hundred times</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eadem imperare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sestertium centiens et octogiens (sc. milia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:35:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 35, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circiter centies sestertium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 5, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
centifidus: <entryFree id="n7403" type="hapax" key="centi^fi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">centĭfĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>centum-findo</etym>, <sense id="n7403.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">divided into a hundred parts</hi>, or, in gen., <hi rend="ital">into a great many parts</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> adv. Symm. 2, 888</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
centifolia: <entryFree id="n7404" type="main" key="centi^fo^li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">centĭfŏlĭa</orth> <etym>centum-folium</etym> rosa, <sense id="n7404.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the hundred-leaved rose</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 4, 10</bibl>, §§ 17 and 18.</sense></entryFree>
centigranium: <entryFree id="n7405" type="main" key="centi^gra_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">centĭgrānĭum</orth> <etym>centum-granum</etym> triticum, <sense id="n7405.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wheat that has a hundred grains</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 10, 21, § 95</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
centimalis: <entryFree id="n7406" type="greek" key="centi^ma_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">centĭmālis</orth> <etym><foreign lang="greek">ke/nthma</foreign></etym> fistula, <sense id="n7406.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surgical instrument</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a trocar;</hi> Fr. trois quarts, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 2, 15, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
centimanus: <entryFree id="n7407" type="main" key="centi^ma^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">centĭmănus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (cf. Prisc. p 718 P.; Lachm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2, p. 107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, p. 107</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>centum-manus</etym>, <sense id="n7407.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having a hundred hands</hi>, an epithet of Gyges, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:17:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 17, 14</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of Typhoeus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:303" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 303</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infantes centimanos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, p. 97</bibl></cit>, acc. to Lachm. l. l. (al. centenarios).</sense></entryFree>
centimeter: <entryFree id="n7408" type="main" key="centi^me^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">centĭmĕter</orth>, <itype>tri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>centum-metrum</etym>, <sense id="n7408.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who employs a hundred</hi>, or, in gen., <hi rend="ital">very</hi> <pb n="316" /> <cb n="CENT" /> <hi rend="ital">many metres</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Terentianus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 9, 265</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
centimetrum: <entryFree id="n7409" type="main" key="centi^metrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">centĭmetrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>centum-metrum</etym>, <sense id="n7409.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the title of a metrical writing of Servius</hi> in Putsch. p. 1817 sq.</sense></entryFree>
centinodius: <entryFree id="n7410" type="main" key="centi^no_di^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">centĭnōdĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>centum-nodus</etym>, <sense id="n7410.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with a hundred knots</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba (an unknown plant),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
centipeda: <entryFree id="n7411" type="main" key="centi^pe^da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">centĭpĕda</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">centŭpĕda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>centum-pes</etym>, <sense id="n7411.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a centipede</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a worm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> millepeda or multipeda, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 39, § 136</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:47" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 6, 16, § 47</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, p. 79</bibl> (in <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 12, 4, 33</bibl>, centupeda).</sense></entryFree>
centipellio: <entryFree id="n7412" type="main" key="centi^pelli^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">centĭpellĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>centum-pellis</etym>, <sense id="n7412.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the second maw of ruminating animals</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 9, 42, § 150</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
centipes: <entryFree id="n7413" type="main" key="centi^pe_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">centĭpēs</orth>, <itype>pĕdis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>centum-pes</etym>, <sense id="n7413.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hundred-footed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scolopendrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 43, 67, § 145</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
centiplex: <entryFree id="n7414" type="main" key="centi^plex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">centĭplex</orth>, v. centuplex.</entryFree>
cento: <entryFree id="n7415" type="main" key="cento1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cento</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">ke/ntrwn</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n7415.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a garment of several bits</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pieces sewed together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a rag-covering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">patchwork</hi>, etc., Cato ap. Fest. s. v. prohibere, p. 234 Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:R. R. 2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> R. R. 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 5</bibl>; Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 176, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0646,001:ib. p. 91:27" default="NO"><author>Sisenn.</author> ib. p. 91, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 44</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7415.1" n="2" level="3"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a cap worn under the helmet</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 8, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7415.2" n="B" level="2"> Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">centones sarcire alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to impose upon by falsehoods</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7415.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The title of a poem made up of various verses of another poem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cento;</hi> so the Cento Nuptialis of Ausonius (the thirteenth of his Idyls), etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 1, 38, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Praescr. 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n7416" type="main" key="Cento2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cento</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n7416.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman cognomen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:14:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 14, 50</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
centobriga: <entryFree id="n7417" type="main" key="Centobri_ga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Centobrīga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n7417.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of the Celtiberi in Spain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:1:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 1, 5</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Centobrīgenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Centobriga</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:1:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 1, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
centoculus: <entryFree id="n7418" type="hapax" key="cento^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">centŏcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>centum-oculus</etym>, <sense id="n7418.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hundred-eyed</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">with a multitude of eyes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Argus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Ezech. 1, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
centonarius: <entryFree id="n7419" type="main" key="cento_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">centōnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. cento</etym>, <sense id="n7419.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to patchwork</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Praescr. 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">VESTIARIVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4296</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n7419.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">centōnārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a maker of patchwork</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a dealer in rags</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 45</bibl>; Cod. Th. 14, 8; 16, 10 al.</sense></entryFree>
centralis: <entryFree id="n7420" type="main" key="centra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">centrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>centrum</etym>, <sense id="n7420.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in the middle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">central</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 23, 21, § 86</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
centratus: <entryFree id="n7421" type="hapax" key="centra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">centrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n7421.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in the middle</hi> or <hi rend="ital">centre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">central</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 1, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
centrinae: <entryFree id="n7422" type="greek" key="centri^nae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">centrĭnae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kentri/nai</foreign>, <sense id="n7422.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of beetle</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wasp</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 27, 44, § 255</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
centrones: <entryFree id="n7423" type="main" key="Centro_nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Centrōnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ke/ntrwnes</foreign>, <sense id="n7423.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Gaul.</hi> </sense><sense id="n7423.1" n="I" level="1"> In Gallia Narbonensis, now <hi rend="ital">Centron</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the valley Tarantaise</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 20, 24, § 135</bibl>.—Hence, Centronicae Alpes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 42, 97, § 240</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n7423.2" n="II" level="1"> In Gallia Belgica, near <hi rend="ital">Courtray</hi>, acc. to Reich. <hi rend="ital">Thorout</hi>, not far from Brügge, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
centrosus: <entryFree id="n7424" type="hapax" key="centro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">centrōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>centrum</etym>, <sense id="n7424.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in the central point.</hi> scobe, i. e. <hi rend="ital">inward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">internal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 7, 26, § 98</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
centrum: <entryFree id="n7425" type="greek" key="centrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">centrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ke/ntron</foreign> (a prickle, sharp point). <sense id="n7425.0" n="I" level="1"> Centrum circini, <hi rend="ital">the stationary foot of the compasses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">around which the other is carried in making a circle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 5</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n7425.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n7425.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The middle point of a circle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the centre</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 15, 13, § 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 19, 17, § 81</bibl> et saep.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">solis terraeque centra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:281" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 29, 69, § 281</bibl></cit> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:17:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 17, 40</bibl>, used as a Greek word).—</sense><sense id="n7425.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A kernel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a hard knot in the interior of wood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precious stones</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 39, 76, § 198</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:28" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 2, 10, § 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:120 al" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 9, 39, § 120 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
centum: <entryFree id="n7426" type="main" key="centum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">centum</orth>, <itype>indecl.</itype> <sense id="n7426.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num.</hi> [Sanscr. catam; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e(-ka-to/n</foreign>; Goth. hund]. </sense><sense id="n7426.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A hundred</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:22:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 22, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et septem anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:5:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 5, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7426.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, for <hi rend="ital">an indefinite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">large number</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi si linguae centum sint, oraque centum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">centum clavibus servata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:14:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 14, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">centum puer artium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 1, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">greges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 16, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cyathi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 8, 14</bibl></cit>: chlamydes. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 41 al.</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:10:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 10, 8</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, ludi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:49" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 49</bibl></cit> Huschk.</sense></entryFree>
centumalus: <entryFree id="n7427" type="main" key="Centuma^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Centumălus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n7427.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman cognomen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:16:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 16, 66</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
centumcapita: <entryFree id="n7428" type="main" key="centum ca^pi^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">centum căpĭta</orth>, <sense id="n7428.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> erynginm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 8, 9, § 20</bibl>.—Also <orth extent="full" lang="la">cen-tum căput</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 1</bibl>, epit. 22, n. 9.</sense></entryFree>
centumcellae: <entryFree id="n7429" type="main" key="Centum Cellae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Centum Cellae</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Centumcellae</orth>,<cb n="CENT" />  <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n7429.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a seaport town in Etruria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Civita Vecchia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:31:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 31, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
