centumgeminus: <entryFree id="n7430" type="main" key="Centumge^mi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Centum-gĕmĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n7430.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hundreafoid</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> epithet of the hundredarmed Briareus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:287" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 287</bibl> Serv.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 14, 8</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and of the hundred-gated Thebes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:118" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 118</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
centumpeda: <entryFree id="n7431" type="main" key="centumpe^da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">centum-pĕda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pes</etym>, <sense id="n7431.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hundredfooted</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 7, 11.</sense></entryFree>
centumpondium: <entryFree id="n7432" type="main" key="centumpondi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">centumpondĭum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">centŭpondĭ-um</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>centum-pondus</etym>, <sense id="n7432.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a weight of a hundred pounds</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
centumvir: <entryFree id="n7433" type="main" key="centumvir"><orth extent="full" lang="la">centumvir</orth>, v. centumviri.</entryFree>
centumviralis: <entryFree id="n7434" type="main" key="centumvi^ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">centumvĭrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>centumviri</etym>, <sense id="n7434.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the centumviri</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:18:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 18, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:39:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 39, 177</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:78" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">causae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:38:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 38, 173</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:2:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 2, 1</bibl> Spald.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:10:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 10, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hasta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:36" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rhet. 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
centumviri: <entryFree id="n7435" type="main" key="centumvi^ri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">centum-vĭri</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">centum vĭri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n7435.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a college</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bench of judges chosen annually for civil suits</hi>, <hi rend="ital">especially those relating to inheritances; consisting of</hi> 105 (in the time of the emperors, of 180) <hi rend="ital">persons</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:38:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 38, 175</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:24:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 24, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:10:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:5" default="NO">4, 2, 5</bibl> Spald.; 4, 1, 57; 7, 4, 10; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:36" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:33 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 33 al.</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Fest. s. v. centumviralia, pp. 54 and 64 Müll., and Dict. of Antiq.—Such a college at Perusia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3719</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">at Veii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 108</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3448</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3706 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
centunculus: <entryFree id="n7436" type="main" key="centuncu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">centuncŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>1. cento</etym>. <sense id="n7436.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small patch</hi> or <hi rend="ital">patchwork</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 80:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 80, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 104 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n7436.1" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a partycolored saddle-cloth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 14, 7</bibl> Weissenb. —</sense><sense id="n7436.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bind-weed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">knotweed</hi>: Polygonum convolvulus, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 15, 88, § 138</bibl>; as <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 11, 66, § 105</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
centuplex: <entryFree id="n7437" type="main" key="centu^plex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">centŭplex</orth> (in MSS. also <orth extent="full" lang="la">centĭplex</orth>), <itype>plĭcis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>centum-plico</etym>, <sense id="n7437.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hundredfold</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">murus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 11</bibl></cit> (where Fleck. Krit. Misc. p. 36, would read centupulus; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">centuplus): fructus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 7, 220</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">centuplicem ferre frugem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> Hist. Sacr. 2, 799</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
centuplico: <entryFree id="n7438" type="main" key="centu_^pli^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">centū^plĭco</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n7438.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to increase a hundredfold</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">populum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 24, 3</bibl></cit>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">centŭplī^cātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, <hi rend="ital">increased a hundredfold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">centuple</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Contr. Symm. 2, 1050</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cen-tŭplī^cāta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a hundredfold</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">capere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> Hist. Sacr. 3, 548</bibl></cit>.—And <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">centŭplĭcātō</orth> <itype>vēnire</itype>, <hi rend="ital">to be sold a hundred times dearer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 23, 26, § 101</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
centuplus: <entryFree id="n7439" type="main" key="centu_^plus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">centū^plus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>centum-plus</etym>, <sense id="n7439.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hundredfold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">centuple</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">fructus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 8, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fenoris usus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> Avit. ad Sor. 365</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">augere populum suum centuplum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,015:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Par. 21, 3</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">centū^plum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a hundredfold</hi>: accipere, Aug. Civ. Dei, 20, 7; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:19:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 19, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">invenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:26:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Gen. 26, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reddere alicui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Salv.</author> adv. Avar. 3, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
centupondium: <entryFree id="n7440" type="main" key="centu^pondi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">centŭpondĭum</orth>, v. centumpondium.</entryFree>
centuria: <entryFree id="n7441" type="main" key="centu^ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">centŭrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>centum</etym>, orig., <sense id="n7441.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an assemblage</hi> or <hi rend="ital">a division consisting of a hundred things of a kind;</hi> hence in gen., <hi rend="ital">any division</hi>, even if it consists not of a hundred. </sense><sense id="n7441.1" n="I" level="1"> In agricult., <hi rend="ital">a number of acres of ground</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:4:10:section=35" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 4, 10, § 35</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. R. 1, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:18:5" default="NO">18, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:1:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Lim. p. 154" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Lim. p. 154</bibl> Goes.—</sense><sense id="n7441.2" n="II" level="1"> In milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">a division of troops</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a century</hi>, <hi rend="ital">company</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">centuriae, quae sub uno centurione sunt, quorum centenarius justus numerus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5</bibl></cit>. 16, 26, § <cit><quote lang="la">88, p. 26 Bip.: centuriae tres equitum, Ramnenses, Titienses, Luceres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 13, 8</bibl></cit>: in legione sunt centuriae sexaginta, manipuli triginta, cohortes decem, Cincius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:4:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 4, 6</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 13 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 64</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 91:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 91, 1</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n7441.3" n="III" level="1"> Of the Roman people, <hi rend="ital">one of the one hundred and ninety-three orders into which Servius Tullius divided the Roman people according to their property</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a century</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:22:39 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 22, 39 sq.</bibl> Moser; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:43:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 43, 1 sq.</bibl>; cf. Dion. Halic. 4, 16 sq.; Nieb. Röm. Gesch. 1, p. 477 sq.—Hence the assemblies in which they voted acc. to centuries were called comitia centuriata; <cit><quote lang="la">v. 1. centurio. The century designated by lot as voting first was called centuria praerogativa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:20:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 20, 49</bibl></cit>; v. praerogativus; cf. Dict. of Antiq. <cb n="CENT" /></sense></entryFree>
centurialis: <entryFree id="n7442" type="main" key="centu^ri^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">centŭrĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>centuria</etym>, <sense id="n7442.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to a century.</hi> </sense><sense id="n7442.1" n="1" level="3"> In agriculture: lapides, <hi rend="ital">boundary stones for single centuries</hi>, Auct. Lim. p. 298 Goes.—</sense><sense id="n7442.2" n="2" level="3"> In the division of the people: civis, <hi rend="ital">appointed to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">placed in any century</hi>, Fest. s. v. ni quis scivit, p. 177 Müll.—</sense><sense id="n7442.3" n="3" level="3"> In milit. lang.: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 23, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
centuriatim: <entryFree id="n7443" type="main" key="centu^ri^a_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">centŭrĭātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n7443.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">By companies</hi> or <hi rend="ital">centuries</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 76</bibl> Oud. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">centuriatim citare populum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:20:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 20, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tributim et centuriatim descriptis ordinibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 7, 15</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n7443.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">in masses</hi> or <hi rend="ital">crowds</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by hundreds</hi>, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 18, 12</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 153 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
centuriatio: <entryFree id="n7444" type="main" key="centu^ri^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">centŭrĭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. centurio</etym>, <sense id="n7444.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dividing into centuries.</hi> only in the Agrimensores, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Lim. p. 206" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Lim. p. 206</bibl> Goes.</sense></entryFree>
centuriatus: <entryFree id="n7445" type="main" key="centu^ri^a_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">centŭrĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from 1. centurio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n7446" type="main" key="centu^ri^a_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">centŭrĭātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. centurio</etym>. <sense id="n7446.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A division into centuries</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:38:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 38, 3</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n7446.1" n="II" level="1"> [2. centurio.] <hi rend="ital">The office of centurion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 13, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:36:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 36, 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
centurio: <entryFree id="n7447" type="main" key="centu^ri^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">centŭrĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>centuria</etym>, <sense id="n7447.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to divide into centuries</hi> (acc. to centuria, I.). </sense><sense id="n7447.1" n="I" level="1"> Of land: <cit><quote lang="la">agrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Lim. p. 195" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Lim. p. 195</bibl></cit> Goes.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=53" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 53</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n7447.2" n="II" level="1"> Of the army (only of infantry; cf. decurio), <hi rend="ital">to arrange in centuries</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assign to companies</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum homines in tribunali Aurelio palam conscribi centuriarique vidissem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,018:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Red. Quir. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: rem gerit palam (Octavius); centuriat Capuae; <cit><quote lang="la">dinumerat. Jam jamque vides bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juventutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:15:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 15, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seniores quoque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites decuriati, centuriati pedites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:38:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 38, 3</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 21, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juventus Romana... equis delapsa se ipsam centuriavit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>reduced to infantry</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 2</bibl></cit>, n. 8: mulus centuriatus, for <hi rend="ital">carrying provisions</hi>, Aur. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 7, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7447.3" n="B" level="2"> Facetiously: <cit><quote lang="la">eripiam ego hodie concubinam militi, Si centuriati bene sunt maniplares mei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 4, 29</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7447.4" n="III" level="1"> Of the people in the meeting of the council, only <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: comitia centuriata, <hi rend="ital">in which all the Roman people voted according to centuries</hi> (this was done in the choice of higher magistrates, in decisions in respect to war and peace, and, until Sulla's time, in questions affecting life or citizenship; cf. Messala ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:15:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 15, 4</bibl>; Lael. Felix <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:27:4" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 15, 27, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Red. Sen. 11, 27</bibl>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:19:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 19, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ad populum centuriatis comitiis tulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 8, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:55:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 55, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:12:15" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 12, 15</bibl>.—Facetiously: <cit><quote lang="la">Pseudolus mihi centuriata capitis habuit comitia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>has sentenced me to death</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 134</bibl></cit> Lorenz ad loc.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">centŭrĭā-tus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the</hi> comitia centuriata: Centuriata lex, <hi rend="ital">advised in the</hi> comitia centuriata, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 11, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n7448" type="main" key="centu^ri^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">centŭrĭo</orth> (in many inscriptions before the time of Quintilian erroneously aspirated chenturio, like <sense id="n7448.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ch</hi>oronae, prae<hi rend="ital">ch</hi>ones, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 20</bibl>; cf. the letter C), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (access. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">centŭrĭōnus</orth>, <itype>like curionus and decurionus</itype>, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=49" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 49</bibl> Müll.) [centuria, II.], <hi rend="ital">the commander of a century</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a captain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">centurion</hi>, occupying a station below the tribunus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:15:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 15, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 59:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 59, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:27:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 27, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:41:5" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 41, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 73</bibl>; cf. Dict. of Antiq.</sense></entryFree>
centurionatus: <entryFree id="n7449" type="main" key="centu^ri^o_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">centŭrĭōnātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>2. centurio</etym>, <sense id="n7449.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the office of a centurion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 2</bibl>, ext. 23.—</sense><sense id="n7449.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An election of centurions</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 44</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
centuripae: <entryFree id="n7450" type="main" key="Centu^ri^pae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Centŭrĭpae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (or perh. <orth extent="full" lang="la">-a</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>; access. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Centŭrĭpīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:16" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 16</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">*kento/ripa, ta/</foreign>, Thuc., <sense id="n7450.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a very old town in Sicily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Ætna</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Centorbi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:204" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 204</bibl> (al. leg. Centări\pe); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 7, 41, § 86</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n7450.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Centŭ-rĭpīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Centuripœ</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:49:section=120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 49, § 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 58</bibl></cit>, § 143; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 3, 45, § 108: crocum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 6, 17, § 31</bibl></cit>.—And <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Centŭrĭpī-ni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Centuripœ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:23:section=50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 23, § 50</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 45, § 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 91</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
centussis: <entryFree id="n7451" type="main" key="centussis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">centussis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>centum-as</etym>, <sense id="n7451.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hundred</hi> asses, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=170" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 170</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:9:section=81" default="NO">9, § 81</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> centussis, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:19:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 19, 2</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Abl.</hi> centusse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:191" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 191</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: centussibus,<pb n="317" /> <cb n="CEPH" />  Fest. s. v. peculatus, p. 237 Müll.— Hence, in allusion to the law of Faunius, limiting the expenditure on games: Fauni centussis misellus, Lucil. ap <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:24:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 24, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cenula: <entryFree id="n7452" type="main" key="ce_nu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cēnŭla</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">caen-</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">coen-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>cena</etym>, <sense id="n7452.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little dinner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hesterna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:32:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 32, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere cenulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 24, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">parva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:78" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 78 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
ceos: <entryFree id="n7453" type="main" key="Ceos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ceos</orth>, v. Cea.</entryFree>
cepa: <entryFree id="n7454" type="main" key="ce_pa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cēpa</orth>, v. caepa.</entryFree>
cepaea: <entryFree id="n7455" type="greek" key="ce_paea"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cēpaea</orth>, ae. <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">khpai/a</foreign>, <sense id="n7455.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant similar to the portulacca</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the portulacca-leaved sedum</hi>: Sedum cepaea, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 52, § 84</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cephalaea: <entryFree id="n7456" type="greek" key="ce^pha^laea"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕphălaea</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kefalai/a</foreign>, <sense id="n7456.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a continued pain in the head</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a lasting headache</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 13, 51, § 135</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:1:28" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 1, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cephalaeota: <entryFree id="n7457" type="greek" key="ce^pha^laeo_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕphălaeōta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kefalaiw/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n7457.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a collector of a capitation tax</hi>, Cod. Th. 11, 24, 6.</sense></entryFree>
cephalalgia: <entryFree id="n7458" type="greek" key="ce^pha^lalgi_^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕphălalgī^a</orth>, or euphon. <orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕphăl-argī^a</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kefalalgi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n7458.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a headache</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 1, 3</bibl>; Aem. Mac. cap. de Acidula.</sense></entryFree>
cephalalgicus: <entryFree id="n7459" type="greek" key="ce^pha^lalgi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕphălalgĭcus</orth> (euphon. <orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕphăl-argĭcus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">kefalalgiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n7459.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sick with a headache</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 1, 25, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cephalenia: <entryFree id="n7460" type="main" key="Ce^pha^le_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĕphălēnĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-allānia</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kefalhni/a</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">*kefallhni/a</foreign>, <sense id="n7460.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the largest island in the Ionian Sea</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Cephalonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:10" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:54 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 19, § 54 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:13:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 13, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 9, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:28:7" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 28, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:9:4" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 9, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7460.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n7460.2" n="a" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĕphălēnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kefalh=nes</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Cephalenia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:13:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 13, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:305" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 305</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7460.3" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĕphălēnītae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, the same, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. E. 8, 68</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cephalicus: <entryFree id="n7461" type="greek" key="ce^pha^li^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕphălĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">kefaliko/s</foreign>; in medicine, <sense id="n7461.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to the head</hi>, <hi rend="ital">head-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">emplastrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:19:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 19, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 6, 28, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cephalio: <entryFree id="n7462" type="main" key="Ce^pha^lio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĕphălio</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, prob. <sense id="n7462.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a slave of Atticus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 25 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl> al.</sense></entryFree>
cephalo: <entryFree id="n7463" type="main" key="ce^pha^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕphălo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)gke/falon</foreign>, <sense id="n7463.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a palmtree</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Apr. 5, 2</bibl> Schneid.</sense></entryFree>
cephaloedis: <entryFree id="n7464" type="main" key="Ce^pha^loedis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĕphăloedis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĕphăloedĭ-um</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 596</bibl> P.), = <foreign lang="greek">*kefaloidi/s</foreign> Ptol., <foreign lang="greek">*kefaloi/dion</foreign> Strab., <sense id="n7464.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small fortified town in Sicily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the region of Himera</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Cefali</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:52:section=128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 52, § 128</bibl> Zumpt <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 90</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7464.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n7464.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĕphăloedĭtānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Cephalœdis</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:43:section=103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 43, § 103</bibl></cit>.—And <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĕphăloedĭtā-ni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Cephalœdis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:52:section=130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 52, § 130</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7464.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĕphăloe-dĭas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. fem.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of Cephalœdis</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:252" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 252</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cephalote: <entryFree id="n7465" type="main" key="ce^pha^lo_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕphălōtē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <sense id="n7465.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">kefalwth/</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">having a head</hi> (pure Lat. capitata), <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 23, 427</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cephalus: <entryFree id="n7466" type="main" key="Ce^pha^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĕphălus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ke/falos</foreign>, <sense id="n7466.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a son of Deïoneus</hi> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 189" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 189</bibl>) or <hi rend="ital">of Pandion</hi> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:ib. 279" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 279</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">a grandson of Æolus</hi> (hence, Aeolides, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:681" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 681</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">the husband of Procris</hi>, whom he, when watched by her, unintentionally shot, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:681" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 681</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 665</bibl> sq.; 7, 841; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:35" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 2, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 6, 445</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cepheis: <entryFree id="n7467" type="main" key="Ce_phe_is"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cēphēïs</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, v. Cepheus, II. C.</entryFree>
cepheius: <entryFree id="n7468" type="main" key="Cephe_ius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cephēïus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Cepheus, II. A.</entryFree>
cephenes: <entryFree id="n7469" type="greek" key="ce_phe_nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cēphēnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">khfh=nes</foreign>. <sense id="n7469.0" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The drones in a swarm of bees</hi> (pure Lat. fuci), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 16, 16, § 48</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7469.1" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cēphē-nes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">a people of Ethiopia</hi> (so called from their king, Cepheus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 1</bibl> and 97.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cēphēnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Ethiopian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">proceres,</quote> <trans><tr>the Ethiopian chiefs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:764" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 764</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cepheus: <entryFree id="n7470" type="main" key="Ce_pheus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cēpheus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dissyl.</orth>), <itype>ei</itype> (<sense id="n7470.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> Cēphĕos, Germ. Arat. 189; <case>acc.</case> Cēphĕă, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:11:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 11, 3</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*khfeu/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a king of Ethiopia</hi> (acc. to Mel. l. l. at Joppa, in Phoenicia), <hi rend="ital">husband of Cassiope. father of Andromeda</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and father-in-law of Perseus;</hi> finally placed with these three among the stars, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:738" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 738</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 64" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Astr. 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:3:8" default="NO">3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:3:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:43:111" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 43, 111</bibl>; Germ. Arat. 184 al.—</sense><sense id="n7470.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence, <hi rend="ital">adjj.</hi> </sense><sense id="n7470.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cēphēïus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of Cepheus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Andromeda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:3:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgo, the same,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 3, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7470.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cēphēus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">trisyl.</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of Cepheus</hi>, = <hi rend="ital">Ethiopian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Meroe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 6, 78: <cit><quote lang="la">arva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:669" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 669</bibl></cit>. <cb n="CERA" /> —</sense><sense id="n7470.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cēphēïs</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <hi rend="ital">Andromeda</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 191</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 1, 426</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cephisus: <entryFree id="n7471" type="main" key="Ce_phi_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cēphīsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-ŏs</orth>) or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cēphissus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*khfi=sis</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">*khfisso/s</foreign>. <sense id="n7471.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A river in Phocis and Bœotia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Cephisso</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Gaurio</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">Gerios</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:349" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 349</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 175</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 12</bibl>, §§ 26 and 27; <hi rend="ital">as river-god</hi>, <hi rend="ital">father of Narcissus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:343" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 343</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:340" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 340</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n7471.1" n="2" level="3"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n7471.2" n="a" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cēphīsĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cēphissĭ-us</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = Narcissus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:351" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 351</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7471.3" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cē-phīsis</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cēphissis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. fem.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of Cephisus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">undas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:369" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 369</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7471.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A river on the west side of Athens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">emptying into the Saronic Gulf</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:388" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 388</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7471.5" n="B" level="2"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n7471.6" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cēphīsĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">name of a small district of Altica</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abounding in springs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:10:1" default="NO">18, 10, 1</bibl>; and of <hi rend="ital">a fountain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 11, § 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7471.7" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cēphīsĭăs</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Cēphissĭas</orth>), <itype>ădis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. fem.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of Cephisus</hi>: ora, <hi rend="ital">the banks of the Attic Cephisus</hi>, where Procrustes had his abode, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:438" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 438</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cepina: <entryFree id="n7472" type="main" key="ce_pi_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cēpīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. caepina.</entryFree>
cepitis: <entryFree id="n7473" type="main" key="ce_pi_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cēpītis</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">cēpŏlătītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n7473.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi> unknown to us, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 56, § 152</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cepolindrum: <entryFree id="n7474" type="main" key="cepolindrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cepolindrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n7474.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of condiment</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ceponides: <entryFree id="n7475" type="main" key="ce_po^ni^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cēpŏnĭdes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n7475.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi> now unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 56, § 156</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cepos: <entryFree id="n7476" type="greek" key="ce_po^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cēpŏs Aphrŏdītēs</orth>, = <foreign lang="greek">kh=pos )*afrodi/ths</foreign>, hortus Veneris, <sense id="n7476.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, usu. called cotyledon, q. v., <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cepotaphiolum: <entryFree id="n7477" type="gloss" key="ce_po^ta^phi^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cēpŏtăphĭŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>cepotaphium</etym>, <sense id="n7477.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little tomb in a garden</hi>, Inscr. Marin. Fratr. Arv. p. 184; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> 115</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">294</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cepotaphium: <entryFree id="n7478" type="greek" key="ce_po^ta^phi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cēpŏtăphĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">khpota/fion</foreign>, <sense id="n7478.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tomb in a garden</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4514 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
cepulla: <entryFree id="n7479" type="main" key="ce_pulla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cēpulla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. caepina.</entryFree>
cepuricus: <entryFree id="n7480" type="greek" key="ce_pu_ri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cēpūrĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">khponriko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n7480.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to gardening</hi>: loca, Firm. Math. 2, 12.—Hence, in <hi rend="ital">neutr. plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cē-pūrĭca</orth>; <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> -cōn, <hi rend="ital">a treatise on gardening</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 10, 57, § 177</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cepuros: <entryFree id="n7481" type="greek" key="Ce_pu_ro^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cēpūrŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">khpouro/s</foreign>, <sense id="n7481.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gardener</hi>, the title of the third book of Apicius.</sense></entryFree>
cera: <entryFree id="n7482" type="main" key="ce_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cēra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. kar-, to scatter, throw away; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kri/nw</foreign>; Lat. cerno; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">khro/s</foreign>; cf. sincerus</etym>, <sense id="n7482.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wax</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:516" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 516</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:966" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 966</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:45:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 45, 177</bibl>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:45:108" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 45, 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:15:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 15, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:16:1" default="NO">9, 16, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:83 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 14, 49, § 83 sq.</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 32</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">the wax cells of the hives</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 57</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 162</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 241</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:7" default="NO">9, 7</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:118 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 8, 8, § 118 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n7482.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, acc. to its diff. uses. </sense><sense id="n7482.2" n="A" level="2"> Most freq., <hi rend="ital">a writing-tablet covered with wax</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 3, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 7, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:521" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 521</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:24:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 24, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:31" default="NO">10, 3, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:32" default="NO">11, 2, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:83 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 83 al.</bibl> —Hence, prima, secunda, etc., cera, <hi rend="ital">the first</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">leaf</hi> or <hi rend="ital">page</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:36:section=92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 36, § 92</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7482.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A seal of wax</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 96</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 16, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:15:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 15, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 51, 52, § 137</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7482.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A waxen image of an ancestor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a wax figure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cera illa (sc. majorum imaginum) atque figura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 4, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:591" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 591</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:19" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 19</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">expressi cerā voltus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 2, 2, § 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7482.5" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Wax used in encaustic painting</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:17:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 17, 4</bibl> Schneid.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 7, 31, § 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 11, 39, § 122</bibl>; and 35, 11, 41, § 149; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:1:100" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 1, 100</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cerachates: <entryFree id="n7483" type="greek" key="ce_ra^cha_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cērăchātes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">khraxa/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n7483.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the wax-agate</hi> (so called from its color), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 54, § 139</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cerambus: <entryFree id="n7484" type="main" key="Ce^rambus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĕrambus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ke/rambos</foreign>, <sense id="n7484.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mythological person</hi>, <hi rend="ital">changed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the time of the flood of Deucalion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">into a beetle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:353" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 353</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ceramicus: <entryFree id="n7485" type="main" key="Ce^ra^mi_cus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĕrămīcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kerameiko/s</foreign> (the pot-maker), <sense id="n7485.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of two places</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one within and the other without Athens;</hi> in the latter were the monuments and statues of heroes that had fallen in war, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:11:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 11, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:26:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 26, 64</bibl>; Attic. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:155" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 12, 45, § 155</bibl> (cf. Pausan. 1, 29, 2 Siebel. and Meurs. in Thes. Gron. iv. p. 1006 sq.).</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n7486" type="main" key="Ce^ra^mi_cus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĕrămīcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Ceramus.</entryFree>
ceramitis: <entryFree id="n7487" type="greek" key="ce^ra^mi_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕrămītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kerami=tis</foreign>, <sense id="n7487.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone of the color of brick</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 56, § 153</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ceramus: <entryFree id="n7488" type="main" key="Ce^ra^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĕrămus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ke/ramos</foreign>, <sense id="n7488.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town on</hi> <cb n="CERA" /> <hi rend="ital">the coast of Caria</hi>, after which the Ceramicus Sinus (now <hi rend="ital">the Gulf of Kos</hi>) is named, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:16:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 16, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:29:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 29</bibl>, §§ 107 and 109.</sense></entryFree>
cerarius: <entryFree id="n7489" type="main" key="ce_ra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cērārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cera</etym>, <sense id="n7489.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to wax</hi>, only <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n7489.1" n="I" level="1"> <itype>Cerarius, ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n7489.2" n="A" level="2"> <foreign lang="greek">*khropw/lhs</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a dealer in wax</hi>, Gloss. Gr. Lat. —</sense><sense id="n7489.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A writer upon wax tablets</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4109</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n7489.4" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">cērārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">she who makes wax-lights</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 101</bibl> dub.—* </sense><sense id="n7489.5" n="III" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">cērārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">wax-money</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a revenue either for wax used in waxen tablets</hi>, <hi rend="ital">or</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perhaps</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as a fee for affixing a seal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:78:section=181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 78, § 181</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ceras: <entryFree id="n7490" type="greek" key="ce^ra^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕrăs</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ke/ras</foreign> (a horn), <sense id="n7490.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of wild parsnip</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 80</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7490.1" n="II" level="1"> Hesperion Ceras, = <foreign lang="greek">(*espe/rion ke/ras</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a mountain on the west coast of Libya</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 30, 35, § 197</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cerasinus: <entryFree id="n7491" type="greek" key="ce^ra^si^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕrăsĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">kera/sinos</foreign>, <sense id="n7491.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cherry-colored</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cingulum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 28, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 67, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cerastes: <entryFree id="n7492" type="greek" key="ce^rastes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕrastes</orth>, <itype>ae or is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kera/sths</foreign> (horned). <sense id="n7492.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A horned serpent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the cerastes</hi>: Coluber cerastes, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 23, 35, § 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:126" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 37, 45, § 126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:716" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 716</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 22, 27; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:27:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 27, 7</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">as an attrib. of the hair of the Furies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:103" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 103</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 65</bibl>; Claud. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Rufin.</author> 1, 96</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 346</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7492.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of horned worm injurious to trees</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 41, 80, § 220</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:221" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 24, 37, § 221</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n7492.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">As nom. propr.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĕrastae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, acc. to the fable, <hi rend="ital">a horned people in Cyprus</hi>, changed by Venus into bullocks, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:222 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 222 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
cerasum: <entryFree id="n7493" type="main" key="ce^ra^sum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕrăsum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. 1. cerasus, II.</entryFree>
cerasus: <entryFree id="n7494" type="main" key="ce^ra^sus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕrăsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ke/rasos</foreign>, <sense id="n7494.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the cherrytree</hi>, brought by Lucullus from Cerasus, in Pontus, to Italy, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:39:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 39, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 2, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 25, 30, § 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:96" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 96</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Nuc. 32 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n7494.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A cherry</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 2, 15; in prose, instead of it, <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕrăsum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:24:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 24, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Oct. 12, 7 al.</bibl>—Of doubtful gender: <cit><quote lang="la">ceraso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:36" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cerasorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 25, 30, § 102</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:112" default="NO" valid="yes">15, 28, 34, § 112</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n7495" type="main" key="Ce^ra^su_s2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĕrăsūs</orth>, <itype>untis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kerasou=s</foreign>, <sense id="n7495.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Pontus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where the cherry is native</hi> (v. 1. cerasus), now <hi rend="ital">Keresun</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:19:11" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 19, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 4, 4, § 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ceratia: <entryFree id="n7496" type="greek" key="ce^ra^ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕrătĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kerati/a</foreign>, <sense id="n7496.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant with a single leaf</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 34, § 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ceratias: <entryFree id="n7497" type="greek" key="ce^ra^ti^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕrătĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kerati/as</foreign>, <sense id="n7497.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of comet resembling a horn</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 25, 22, § 90</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ceratina: <entryFree id="n7498" type="greek" key="ce^ra^ti^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕrătĭna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kerati/na</foreign>, <sense id="n7498.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the sophistical argument concerning horns</hi> (quod non perdidisti habes; <cit><quote lang="la">cornua non perdidisti: habes igitur cornua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:2:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 2, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 45:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 45, 7</bibl>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 5</bibl> Spald.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Eloq. p. 86" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Eloq. p. 86</bibl> Nieb.</sense></entryFree>
ceratitis: <entryFree id="n7499" type="greek" key="ce^ra^ti_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕrătītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kerati=tis</foreign> (horned), <sense id="n7499.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of wild poppy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 19, 78, § 205</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ceratium: <entryFree id="n7500" type="greek" key="ce^ra^ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕrătĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kera/tion</foreign> (St. John's bread), <sense id="n7500.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek weight corresponding to the Latin</hi> siliqua = 2. calculi, Auct. Ponder. in Goes. Agrar. p. 322 (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:20" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10, 20</bibl>, and Arb. 25, 1, written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
ceratum: <entryFree id="n7501" type="main" key="ce_ra_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cērātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">cērōtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:98" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 98</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 41, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 3, 7, 2</bibl>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cērātōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:11" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 35</bibl>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cērōtūrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 1, 9</bibl>), <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">khrwto/n</foreign>, <sense id="n7501.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wax plaster</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wax salve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wax pomatum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 4, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 4, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:7:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 22, 43, § 124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:117" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 24, 56, § 117</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:141" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 14, 87, § 141</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 250" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 250</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ceratura: <entryFree id="n7502" type="hapax" key="ce_ra_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cērātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cera</etym>, <sense id="n7502.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a smearing over</hi> or <hi rend="ital">covering with wax</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:50:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 50, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ceratus: <entryFree id="n7503" type="main" key="ce_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cērātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from cero.</entryFree>
ceraula: <entryFree id="n7504" type="greek" key="ce^raula"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕraula</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kerau/lhs</foreign>, <sense id="n7504.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hornblower</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corneter</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 213</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Flor. 4, p. 342</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ceraunia: <entryFree id="n7505" type="main" key="ce^rauni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕraunĭa</orth>, v. ceronia.</entryFree>
ceraunius: <entryFree id="n7506" type="greek" key="ce^rauni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕraunĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">kerau/nios</foreign> (pertaining to thunder or lightning). <sense id="n7506.0" n="I" level="1"> Gemma (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕraunĭum</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Ser. 77</bibl>; and: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕraunus</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 470</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">a kind of onyx</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:134 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 51, § 134 sq.</bibl>; or <hi rend="ital">a meteoric stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 10, 65, § 176</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Elag. 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2510</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemma,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, §§ 67 and 75.—</sense><sense id="n7506.1" n="II" level="1"> Vites, <hi rend="ital">of a red color</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 17, 5, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7506.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Nom. propr.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĕraunĭi</orth>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n7506.3" n="A" level="2"> (Also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĕrau-nĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:332" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 332</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:506" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 506</bibl>; <pb n="318" /> <cb n="CERD" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:8:19" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 8, 19</bibl>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĕraunum saxum</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2</bibl> (3), 16, 3.) <foreign lang="greek">*kerau/nia o)/rh</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a ridge of mountains in Epirus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the borders of Grecian Illyria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Monti della Chimœra</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Kimara</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:10" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a Cerauniis montibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 29, 36, § 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cerauniorum saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:9:4" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 9, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7506.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A mountain in Asia Minor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between the Black and Caspian Seas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:19:13" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 19, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:5:4" default="NO">3, 5, 4</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called Ceraunius mons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 27, § 99</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 683</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7506.5" n="C" level="2"> Ceraunius saltus, <hi rend="ital">a mountain in Libya</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:8:10" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 8, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ceraunobolia: <entryFree id="n7507" type="greek" key="Ce^rauno^bo^li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĕraunŏbŏlĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*keraunoboli/a</foreign>, <sense id="n7507.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the hurling of the thunderbolts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a painting of Apelles</hi> (<case>acc.</case> -an), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 96</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ceraunus: <entryFree id="n7508" type="main" key="ce^raunus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕraunus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. ceraunius.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n7509" type="main" key="Ce^raunus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĕraunus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kerauno/s</foreign>, <sense id="n7509.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cognomen of king Ptolemœus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of Macedonia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son of Ptolemœus Lagi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,021:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Reg. 3, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cerberion: <entryFree id="n7510" type="main" key="Cerbe^rion"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cerbĕrion</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n7510.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ancient name of the town Cimmerium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Cimmerian Bosphorus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 6, 6, § 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cerberus: <entryFree id="n7511" type="main" key="Cerbe^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cerbĕrus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-ros</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ke/rberos</foreign>, <sense id="n7511.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the three-</hi> (acc. to others, the hundred-) <hi rend="ital">headed monster Cerberus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:483" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 483</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:417" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 417</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 5, 44; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:19:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 19, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 11, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:450" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 450</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 151" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 151</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:400" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 400</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:13:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 13, 34</bibl>); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:5:10 al" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 5, 10 al.</bibl> —Hence, </sense><sense id="n7511.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cerbĕrĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Cerberus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facies canum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:735" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 735</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">os,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:501" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 501</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:1:249" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 1, 249</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of the Lower World</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 8, 56</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cercasorum: <entryFree id="n7512" type="main" key="Cercaso_rum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cercasōrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kerka/swron</foreign>, <sense id="n7512.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Egypt</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">El-Arkas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:9:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 9, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cerceris: <entryFree id="n7513" type="gloss" key="cerce_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cercēris</orth>, <sense id="n7513.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bird living in the water and on land</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:13:23" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 13, 23</bibl> Speng. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> (Müll. § 79, <foreign lang="greek">kerkouri/s</foreign>).</sense></entryFree>
cercetae: <entryFree id="n7514" type="main" key="Cerce^tae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cercĕtae</orth>, <itype>arum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n7514.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Pontus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 5, 5, § 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:2:5 al" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 2, 5 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
cercetius: <entryFree id="n7515" type="main" key="Cerce^ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cercĕtĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n7515.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a southern spur of Mount Pindus in Thessaly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 14, 7</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 8, 15, § 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cercina: <entryFree id="n7516" type="main" key="Cerci_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cercīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ke/rkina</foreign>, <sense id="n7516.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island off the east coast of Africa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with a town of the same name</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Kerkein</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Kerkena</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 7, 7, § 41</bibl>; Auct. B. Afr. 34; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:48:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 48, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 53</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:2:section=42" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 2, 2, § 42</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">The inhabitants</hi>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cercīnātes</orth>, Auct. B. Afr. 34.</sense></entryFree>
cercinitis: <entryFree id="n7517" type="main" key="Cercini_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cercinītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n7517.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small island very near Cercina</hi>, <hi rend="ital">connected with it by a bridge</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 7, 7, § 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cercinium: <entryFree id="n7518" type="main" key="Cercinium"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cercinium</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n7518.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Thessaly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:41:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 41, 1</bibl> and 3.</sense></entryFree>
cercitis: <entryFree id="n7519" type="greek" key="cerci_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cercītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kerki=tis</foreign>, <sense id="n7519.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a species of olive-tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:8:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 8, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cercius: <entryFree id="n7520" type="main" key="Cercius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cercius</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. Circius.</entryFree>
cerco: <entryFree id="n7521" type="main" key="Cerco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cerco</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n7521.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman cognomen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 6 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
cercolips: <entryFree id="n7522" type="gloss" key="cercolips"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cercolips</orth>, v. corcholopis.</entryFree>
