cercopithecus: <entryFree id="n7523" type="greek" key="cerco^pi^the_cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cercŏpĭthēcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kerkopi/qhkos</foreign>, <sense id="n7523.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a monkey with a tail</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 201, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 21, 30, § 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:202" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 202</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:128" default="NO">14, 128</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">divine honors were paid to it by the Egyptians,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:4" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> cercopithecon, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:87:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 87, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7523.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cercops: <entryFree id="n7524" type="greek" key="cerco_ps"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cercōps</orth>, <itype>ōpis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ke/rkwy</foreign>. <sense id="n7524.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A species of long-tailed apes</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 664</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 14, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7524.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a Pythagorean philosopher</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:38:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 38, 107</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7524.2" n="III" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cercōpes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ke/rkwpes</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a cunning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trickish people on the island of Pithecusa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">changed by Jupiter into monkeys</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 92</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cercurus: <entryFree id="n7525" type="greek" key="cercu_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cercūrus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cercȳrus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ke/rkouros</foreign>, <sense id="n7525.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of light vessel peculiar to the Cyprians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:prol. 86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. prol. 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 44</bibl>; Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 533, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:19:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 19, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 208</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7525.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sea-fish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:102" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 54, § 152</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cercyo: <entryFree id="n7526" type="main" key="Cercy^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cercyo</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kerkuw/n</foreign>, <sense id="n7526.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated robber in Attica</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conquered and slain by Theseus at Eleusis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:439" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 439</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 187" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 187</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:21:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 21, 1</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> Gr. Cercyona, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:577" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 577</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n7526.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cercyŏnē-us</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Cercyon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:410" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 410</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cercyrus: <entryFree id="n7527" type="main" key="cercy_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cercȳrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. cercurus, II.</entryFree>
cerdiciates: <entryFree id="n7528" type="main" key="Cerdiciates"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cerdiciates</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n7528.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Liguria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:29:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 29, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cerdo: <entryFree id="n7529" type="greek" key="cerdo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cerdo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ke/rdwn [ke/rdos</foreign>], <sense id="n7529.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a</hi> <cb n="CERE" /> <hi rend="ital">handicraftsman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:153" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 153</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:182" default="NO">8, 182</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sutor,</quote> <trans><tr>a cobbler</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:59" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 59</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7529.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A proper name</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">of slaves</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:1:42" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 1, 42</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4161</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cerealis: <entryFree id="n7530" type="main" key="Ce^re^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĕrĕālis</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĕrĭālis</orth>; cf. Serv.ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 177</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 12, 2</bibl> and 4 Orell.), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Ceres</etym>. <sense id="n7530.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pertaining to Ceres</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devoted to her</hi>, and, meton., <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the cultivation of land</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grain</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">agriculture</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemus,</quote> <trans><tr>sacred to Ceres</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:741" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 741</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Eleusin,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:507" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 507</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:439" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 439</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Eleusin Cereri consecrata): papaver (as her symbolic attribute),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 212</bibl></cit> Heyne; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:314" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 314</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cenae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>splendid</tr>, <tr>like those at the festivals of Ceres</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sulci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:12:11" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 12, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 11, 121</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 639</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:122" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 122</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:683" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 683</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 391</bibl> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dona Cereris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:655" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 5, 655</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">herbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:911" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 911</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:127" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 1, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">culmus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:517" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 517</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the implements for grinding and baking</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the cake laid on the ground</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 111</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> v. 109): aediles, <hi rend="ital">who had the superintendence of provisions;</hi> v. aedilis <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n7530.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĕrĕālĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (also in appos.: <cit><quote lang="la">Cerealia ludi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:39:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 39, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: Megalesia ludi, al.), <hi rend="ital">the festival of Ceres</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated on the</hi> 10<hi rend="ital">th of April</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 12, 2</bibl> and 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 15</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:619" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 619</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:389" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 389</bibl> sq.—</sense><sense id="n7530.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Roman cognomen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:52" default="NO">12, 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cerealitas: <entryFree id="n7531" type="gloss" key="Ce^re^a_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĕrĕālĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Cerealis</etym>, <sense id="n7531.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the office of a Cereal edile</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3994</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cerebellare: <entryFree id="n7532" type="main" key="ce^re^bella_re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕrĕbellāre</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>cerebellum</etym>, <sense id="n7532.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a brain-covering</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a head-covering;</hi> only <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 3, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 11, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 12, 6</bibl>; 5, 32, 3.</sense></entryFree>
cerebellum: <entryFree id="n7533" type="main" key="ce^re^bellum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕrĕbellum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>cerebrum</etym>, <sense id="n7533.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small brain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 5, 32, § 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:112" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 13, 38, § 112</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 13</bibl>.—Figuratively, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 76, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cerebrosus: <entryFree id="n7534" type="main" key="ce^re^bro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕrĕbrōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n7534.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having a madness of the brain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hare-brained</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hotbrained</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passionate</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 22, 8 sq.</bibl>: unus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 21</bibl> (but <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 2, 36</bibl>, ellebosus).—Of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">boves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:11:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 11, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cerebrum: <entryFree id="n7535" type="main" key="ce^re_^brum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕrē^brum</orth> (per tmesin: saxo cerecomminuit-brum, Enn. ap. Don. p. 1777 P., and ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 1, 412</bibl>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>root kar- of <foreign lang="greek">ka/rh</foreign>, v. celsus <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>; and root bharof <foreign lang="greek">fe/rw</foreign>, fero; cf. Corss. Beitr. p. 354</etym>, <sense id="n7535.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the brain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 5, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:413" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 413</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 419</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:804" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 804</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:9:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 9, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:133 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 49, § 133 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:102" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 6, 34, § 102</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n7535.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">understanding</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 1, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:50" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 50</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Anger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">choler</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 5, 25</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 17</bibl>: o te, Bolane, cerebri Felicem! ( = cerebrosus, <hi rend="ital">passionate</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 11</bibl>.— * </sense><sense id="n7535.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to plants, <hi rend="ital">the pith in the upper part</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 8, § 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cerellia: <entryFree id="n7536" type="main" key="Ce_rellia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cērellia</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Caer-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n7536.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman lady mentioned in the letters of Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:72:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 72, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:51:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 51, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cereolus: <entryFree id="n7537" type="hapax" key="ce_re^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cērĕŏlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n7537.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [cereus], <hi rend="ital">of the color of wax</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pruna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:404" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 404</bibl></cit> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 13, 12, § 41</bibl>, called cerina).</sense></entryFree>
ceres: <entryFree id="n7538" type="main" key="Ce^re_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĕrēs</orth> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:615" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 615</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:58:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 58, 6</bibl>), ĕris (<sense id="n7538.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> CERERVS, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 626, 225</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1364</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Sabini Cererem panem appellant, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 1, 7</bibl>; prop. the goddess of creation (cf. Serv. l. l.), from the stem cer, Sanscr. kri, to make</etym>, <hi rend="ital">the daughter of Saturn and Ops</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:285" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 285</bibl>, <hi rend="ital">sister of Jupiter and Pluto</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mother of Proserpine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">goddess of agriculture</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">of the cultivation of corn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and of the growth of fruits in gen.</hi> (cf. Cerealis); <cit><quote lang="la">represented as upon a chariot drawn by dragons, with a torch in her hand, and crowned with poppies or ears of corn,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:497" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 497</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 561</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 786</bibl>; 4, 616; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:15" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:4" default="NO">2, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:30" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C. S. 30</bibl>; cf. O. Müll. Archaeol. § 357 sq.: templum Desertae Cereris, <hi rend="ital">deserted</hi> (because the temple was in a solitary, secluded place), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:714" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 714</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cereri nuptias facere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>without wine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 6, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 1, 343</bibl>.—From the names of places where she was worshipped, called Ceres Hennensis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:49:section=107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 49, § 107</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 4, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Catinensis, id. l. l.: Eleusina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 21, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Milesia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 7, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 1</bibl>, ext. 5.—</sense><sense id="n7538.1" n="B" level="2"> Ceres profunda or inferna, i. e. Proserpina, Stat. <cb n="CERN" /> Th. 4, 460; 5, 156; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sacerdos Cererum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 6082</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7538.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">food</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fruit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grain</hi>, etc., Fest. s. v. cocus, p. 45; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fruges Cererem appellamus, vinum autem Liberum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:23:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 23, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:297" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 297</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 177</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 701</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 16, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:437" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 437</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 292</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 112 al.</bibl>—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">sine Cerere et Libero friget Venus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 5, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:23:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 23, 60</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cereus: <entryFree id="n7539" type="main" key="ce_re^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cērĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cera</etym>, <sense id="n7539.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">waxen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of wax.</hi> </sense><sense id="n7539.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:12:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 12, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">effigies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imago,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 8, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 17, 76</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 265</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra,</quote> <trans><tr>cells of wax</tr>, <tr>honey-comb</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:589" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 589</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">regna,</quote> <trans><tr>waxen realms</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul acra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 6, 91</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7539.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cē-rĕus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. funis), <hi rend="ital">a waxlight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wax taper</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:20:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 20, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 122:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 122, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 20:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brev. Vit. 20, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 11:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tranq. 11, 7</bibl>. Such waxlights were brought by clients to their patrons as presents at the time of the Saturnalia, Fest.s.v. cereos, p. 54 Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 7</bibl> and 11; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:18" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7539.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n7539.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Wax-colored</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pruna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 53</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:818" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 818</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">abolla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:53" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turtur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cerei coloris electrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 2, 11, § 33</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n7539.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Pliant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like wax</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bracchia Telephi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 13, 2</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n7539.6" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">easily moved</hi> or <hi rend="ital">persuaded</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cereus in vitium flecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 163</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n7540" type="main" key="ce_re^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cērĕus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. 1. cereus, I. B.</entryFree>
cerevisia: <entryFree id="n7541" type="main" key="cerevisia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cerevisia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. cervisia.</entryFree>
ceria: <entryFree id="n7542" type="foreign" key="ceri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cerĭa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">cerea</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n7542.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Spanish drink</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prepared from corn</hi>, = celia and cerevisia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 82, § 164</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cerifico: <entryFree id="n7543" type="hapax" key="ce_ri^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cērĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype> <etym>cera - facio</etym>, lit., <sense id="n7543.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make wax;</hi> hence of the purple-fish, <hi rend="ital">to slime over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to prepare a slimy nest for eggs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 38, 62, § 133</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cerillae: <entryFree id="n7544" type="main" key="Ce_rillae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cērillae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*khrilloi/</foreign>, <sense id="n7544.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small town on the sea-coast of Bruttium destroyed by Hannibal</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Cirella Vecchia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:580" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 580</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cerimonia: <entryFree id="n7545" type="main" key="ce_ri^mo_nia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cērĭmōnia</orth>, v. caerimonia.</entryFree>
cerintha: <entryFree id="n7546" type="greek" key="ce_rintha"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cērintha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">-ē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 12, 41, § 70</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">khrinqh</foreign>, <sense id="n7546.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant which bees are fond of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wax - flower</hi>: Cerinthe major, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:8:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 8, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cerinthus: <entryFree id="n7547" type="greek" key="ce_rinthus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cērinthus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kh/rinqos</foreign>, <sense id="n7547.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">beebread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> erithace or sandaraca, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 7, 7, § 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cerinus: <entryFree id="n7548" type="greek" key="ce_ri^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cērĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">kh/rinos</foreign>, <sense id="n7548.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">waxcolored</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yellow like wax</hi>: pruna. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:41 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 13, 12, § 41 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">berylli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 5, 20, § 77</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7548.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cērĭna</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a wax-colored garment</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 51</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 548, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ceriolarium: <entryFree id="n7549" type="gloss" key="ce_ri^o^la_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cērĭŏlārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">cērĭŏlāre</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n7549.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a candlestick for wax tapers</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2505 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2515</bibl>; Inscr. Rein. cl. 1, 273; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4068</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ceritis: <entryFree id="n7550" type="greek" key="ce_ri_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cērītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">khri=tis</foreign>, <sense id="n7550.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wax-stone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, now unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 56, § 153</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cerium: <entryFree id="n7551" type="greek" key="ce_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cērĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">khri/on</foreign> (v. Liddell and Scott, under the word, II.), <sense id="n7551.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bad species of swelling</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ulcer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 2, 6, § 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:119" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 7, 63, § 119</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 13</bibl>, written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
cermalus: <entryFree id="n7552" type="main" key="Cerma^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cermălus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. Germalus.</entryFree>
cernentia: <entryFree id="n7553" type="main" key="cernenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cernentĭa</orth>, ae. <gen>f.</gen>, <etym>cernens, cerno</etym>, <sense id="n7553.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the sight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seeing</hi>, opp. to caecitas, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 4</bibl>, §§ 384 and 386.</sense></entryFree>
cerno: <entryFree id="n7554" type="main" key="cerno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cerno</orth>, <itype>crēvi, crētum</itype> (<sense id="n7554.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">part. pass.</hi> cretus is apparently used only once: <cit><quote lang="la">cineris bene creti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 12, 22, 3</bibl></cit>; but freq. in the compounds of cerno; for the simple <hi rend="ital">part.</hi>, the orig. form certus also is very rarely used: <cit><quote lang="la">certā deinde sorte senatus consultum factum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; v. under II. C., and cf. certus), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root car- for scar-, to separate; cf. <foreign lang="greek">kri/nw</foreign>; hence, <foreign lang="greek">skw/r</foreign>, stercus, screo; cf. cera</etym>. </sense><sense id="n7554.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To separate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sift</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">per cribrum, Cato. R. R. 107, 1: farinam cribro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 11, 29, § 115</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 5, 26, § 87</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jun. 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 3, 28, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in cribris omnia cerne cavis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,003:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Med. Fac. 62</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">per densa foramina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cineris bene creti,</quote> <trans><tr>well sifted</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Nov. 22</bibl></cit>.—Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n7554.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n7554.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To separate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinguish by the senses</hi>, mostly <hi rend="ital">by the eyes</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to perceive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">see</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discern</hi> (syn.: video, conspicio; class. in prose and poetry; most freq. probably in Lucretius, where it is used about a hundred times); rarely by the ears; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>: lumen jubarve in caelo cerno? <pb n="319" /> <cb n="CERN" /> Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=81" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 81</bibl> Müll.; <cit><quote lang="la">7, § 76 ib.: sed quis illic est, procul quem video? estne hic Hegio? si satis cerno, is hercle'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum porro varios rerum sentimus odores, nec tamen ad nareis venienteis cernimus umquam: nec voces cernere suemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:300" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 300</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:598" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 598</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod nequeunt oculis rerum primordia cerni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:269" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 269</bibl></cit>; v. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:314 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 314 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:242" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 242</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:837" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 837</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">acute,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:811" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 811</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cerno acutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altaria exhalare vapore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:432" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 432</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:928 al" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 928 al.</bibl>—Hence, sometimes opp. to hearing: <cit><quote lang="la">ut non solum auribus acciperetur, sed etiam oculis cerneretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,020:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timol. 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">or to mental perception: quem ego tam video animo, quam ea, quae oculis cernimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos enim ne nunc quidem oculis cernimus ea, quae videmus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:20:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 20, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae cernere et videre non possumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:40:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 40, 161</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:20:21 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 20, 21 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego Catuli Cumanum ex hoc loco cerno, Pompeianum non cerno,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 25, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ea cernimus quae videmus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:29:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 29, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia sic aperiam, ut ea cernere oculis videamini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:24:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 24, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coram aliquid,</quote> <trans><tr>to witness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:538" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 538</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acies a nostris cernebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in sole sidera ipsa desinunt cerni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simile quiddam facientes aves cernimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:6:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me miserum, turbā quod non ego cernar in illā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:4:43" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 4, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Constitit alma Venus, nulli cernenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:844" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 15, 844</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:13:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 13, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 59</bibl>.—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: sensumque inesse et motum in membris cerno, Canius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=81" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 81</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">neque mutari ac misceri omnia cerneres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: quos ad resistendum concucurrisse cernebat, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cernis ut insultent Rutuli?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cerne quam tenui vos parte contingat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:20:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 20, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cerneres, quanta audacia fuisset, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 61:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 61, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi> with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cernebatur, novissimos illorum premi vehementer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 64</bibl></cit> Herz. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>— So <hi rend="ital">impers.</hi> with <hi rend="ital">rel. -clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut non solum auribus acciperetur, sed etiam oculis cerneretur quem detulisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,020:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timol. 2, 2</bibl></cit>. —Ante-class., of the hearing: vox illius certe est: idem omnes cernimus, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 261, 11</bibl>, and perh. also, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 898</bibl> P.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n7554.4" n="b" level="4"> Cerni aliquā re or in aliquā re, <hi rend="ital">to become distinguished</hi> or <hi rend="ital">known in something</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortis animus et magnus duabus rebus maxime cernitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:20:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 20, 66</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:8:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 8, 22</bibl>: amicus certus in re incertā cernitur, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:17:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 17, 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque hae quidem virtutes cernuntur in agendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:23:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 23, 78</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:21:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 21, 80</bibl> (also in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:5:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 5, 18</bibl>).—* </sense><sense id="n7554.5" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Have before the mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">have respect to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regard</hi> any one: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi gratus, si non eum ipsi cernunt grati, cui referunt gratiam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:18:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 18, 49</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7554.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to intellectual objects, <hi rend="ital">to perceive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comprehend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">understand</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">intellego, cognosco, perspicio): neque tanta in rebus obscuritas, ut eas (res) non penitus acri vir ingenio cernat, si modo aspexerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:31:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 31, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam cernam mene an illam potiorem putes, id. poët. Tusc. 2, 9, 20: (antiquitas) hoc melius ea fortasse, quae erant vera, cernebat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 12, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:19:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 19, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:5:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 5, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:19:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 19, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae cum ego non solum suspicarer, sed plane cernerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:31:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 31, 124</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut consuetum facile amorem cerneres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 108</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n7554.7" n="b" level="4"> Rarely of future events, <hi rend="ital">to foresee</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discern beforehand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cerno animo sepultā in patriā miseros atque insepultos acervos civium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cerno jam animo, quanto omnia uberiora atque ornatiora futura sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7554.8" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To decide something that is contested or doubtful</hi> (judicially), <hi rend="ital">to decree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">determine</hi> (more rare than decernere): <cit><quote lang="la">quotcumque senatus creverit populusque jusserit tot sunto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:3:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quodcumque senatus creverit agunto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 8</bibl></cit>, § 6: jurati cernant. Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 261, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum locum tempusque consilio destinatum quid de Armeniā cernerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">priusquam id sors cerneret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certā sorte,</quote> <trans><tr>after the lot was decided</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n7554.9" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To decide by contending</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fighting</hi> (more rare than the <hi rend="ital">freq.</hi> certare, and even in Seneca's time out of use; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 58:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 58, 3</bibl>): ferro non auro vitam (<hi rend="ital">acc. respect</hi> = de vitā) cernamus<cb n="CERO" />  utrique, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:12:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 12, 38</bibl>; id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 261, 19</bibl>, and ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=81" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 81</bibl> Müll.; Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 261, 21</bibl>: nisi esset qui armis secum vellet cernere, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 261, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cernere ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:709" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 709</bibl></cit> (also ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 58:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 58, 3</bibl>); so, <cit><quote lang="la">cernere certamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 2, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:394" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 394</bibl>: pro patriā, pro liberis, pro aris atque focis suis, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 59:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 59, 5</bibl> Kritz <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> (al. certare): <cit><quote lang="la">seu libeat duplicem sejunctim cernere martem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:103" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 103</bibl></cit>.—Humorously, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 77</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n7554.10" n="D" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to decide for something</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to conclude upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resolve</hi> (syn.: constituo, decerno; also rare): praesidium castris educere, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 261, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">acribus inter se cum armis confligere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> p. 261, 6: <cit><quote lang="la">te mihi amicam esse crevi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit> (crevi valet constitui, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=98" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 98</bibl> Müll.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 150</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n7554.11" n="E" level="2"> In judic. lang. t. t., of inheritances. </sense><sense id="n7554.12" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To resolve to enter upon an inheritance</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=98" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 98</bibl> Müll.; cf. Tit. 22, 27, and cretio.—</sense><sense id="n7554.13" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To make known this determination</hi>, Tit. 22, 28 and 30; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 2, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7554.14" n="3" level="3"> = adire, <hi rend="ital">to enter upon an inheritance</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:15:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 15, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 25, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 8, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:79:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 79, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 261" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 261</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=41" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 41</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7554.15" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">debet etiam fratris Appii amorem erga me cum reliquā hereditate crevisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 10</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 14, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 3</bibl>, ext. 3.—<pos>P. a.</pos> v. certus.</sense></entryFree>
cernualia: <entryFree id="n7555" type="main" key="cernu^a_li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cernŭālĭa</orth>, v. consualia.</entryFree>
cernulo: <entryFree id="n7556" type="main" key="cernu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cernŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>cernuo</etym>, <sense id="n7556.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to throw down</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non vertit fortuna sed cernulat et allidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 8:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 8, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cernulus: <entryFree id="n7557" type="main" key="cernu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cernŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n7557.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">turning a somersault</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 235, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cernuo: <entryFree id="n7558" type="main" key="cernu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cernŭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>cernuus</etym>, <sense id="n7558.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to throw</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fall head foremost</hi> (only ante- and post-class.), Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 21, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, 19, p. 111, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Princ. Hist. 5" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Princ. Hist. 5</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">dep.</hi> form: <cit><quote lang="la">tigres cernuantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus de industriā cernuatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cernuus: <entryFree id="n7559" type="main" key="cernu^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cernŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>root kar, v. celsus; cf. <foreign lang="greek">ka/rhnon</foreign>, cerebrum</etym>, <sense id="n7559.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with the face turned towards the earth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inclined forwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stooping</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bowing forwards</hi> (very rare and only <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">cernuus dicitur proprie inclinatus, quasi quod terram cernit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 20, 33 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:ib. p. 21:1" default="NO"><author>Lucil.</author> ib. p. 21, 1</bibl>: ejectoque incumbit cernuus armo, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:894" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 894</bibl> (v. Serv. ad h. 1.): <cit><quote lang="la">cernuus inflexo sonipes effuderat armo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:255 sq" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 255 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, p. 246</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n7559.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That turns a somersault; a tumbler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mountebank</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">kubisthth/r, petauristh/s</foreign>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 21, 6</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 10, 894</bibl>; cf. Gloss. Philox.: cernuli <foreign lang="greek">petauristai/</foreign>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n7560" type="main" key="cernu^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cernŭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n7560.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of shoe</hi>, acc. to Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=55" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 55</bibl> Müll., and <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 34, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cero: <entryFree id="n7561" type="main" key="ce_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cēro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>cera</etym>, <sense id="n7561.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overlay</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">smear with wax</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to wax</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:52:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 52, 15</bibl></cit>.—More freq. in <hi rend="ital">part. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cerata tabula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: tabella, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 7, 24</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:52" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 52</bibl>: pennae, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">taedae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 42</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">puppes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 447</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ceroferarius: <entryFree id="n7562" type="main" key="ce_ro_fe^ra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cērōfĕrārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cera-fero</etym>, <sense id="n7562.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the waxlight bearer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an attendant at Christian ceremonial worship</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 7, 12, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ceroliensis: <entryFree id="n7563" type="gloss" key="Ceroliensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ceroliensis</orth> <itype>locus</itype>, <sense id="n7563.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place in Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a part of the Carinœ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=47" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 47</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
ceroma: <entryFree id="n7564" type="greek" key="ce_ro_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cērōma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<sense id="n7564.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. plur.</hi> ceromatis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 13, 47, § 168</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">acc. plur.</hi> ceromas, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 114</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">kh/rwma</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">an ointment for wrestlers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">much used in the time of the emperors</hi>, Plin. l. l.; 28, 4, 13, § 51; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:19" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:32" default="NO">7, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:50" default="NO">14, 50</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7564.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n7564.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The place for wrestling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ceromate sedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 12:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 12, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 2, 2, § 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7564.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The ring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the combat</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 8, § 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:65:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 65, 3</bibl> (in <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 1, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>, ceromata is perh. = canceromata, <hi rend="ital">a swelling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tumor</hi>).</sense></entryFree>
ceromaticus: <entryFree id="n7565" type="greek" key="ce_ro_ma^ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cērōmătĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">khrwmatiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n7565.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">smeared with wax-ointment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">collum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3</bibl></cit>. 68.</sense></entryFree>
ceronia: <entryFree id="n7566" type="greek" key="ce^ro_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕrōnĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cĕrān-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kerwni/a</foreign>, <sense id="n7566.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">St. John</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s bread</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 8, 16, § 59</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cerostrota: <entryFree id="n7567" type="main" key="cerostrota"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cerostrota</orth>, v. celostratus and cestrotus.</entryFree>
cerosus: <entryFree id="n7568" type="hapax" key="ce_ro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cērōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cera</etym>, <sense id="n7568.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of wax</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mel,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 3, 13, § 27</bibl></cit>. <cb n="CERT" /></sense></entryFree>
cerotarium: <entryFree id="n7569" type="main" key="ce_ro_ta_rium"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cērōtārium</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. ceratum.</entryFree>
cerotum: <entryFree id="n7570" type="main" key="ce_ro_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cērōtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. ceratum.</entryFree>
cerretani: <entryFree id="n7571" type="main" key="Cerreta_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cerretāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n7571.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Iberian people of</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, <hi rend="ital">among the Pyrenees</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:357" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 357</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cerretānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of the Cerretani</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:54:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 54, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cerreus: <entryFree id="n7572" type="main" key="cerre^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cerrĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cerrus</etym>, <sense id="n7572.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of the Turkey oak</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">glans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:20:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 20, 5</bibl></cit>; Nigid. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 6, 8, § 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">manubria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:ib. 16:43:84:section=230" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> ib. 16, 43, 84, § 230</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cerrinus: <entryFree id="n7573" type="hapax" key="cerri^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cerrĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n7573.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of the Turkey oak</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">calix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 10, 27, § 92</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cerritulus: <entryFree id="n7574" type="hapax" key="cerri_tu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cerrītŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n7574.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [cerritus], <hi rend="ital">somewhat mad</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 806</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cerritus: <entryFree id="n7575" type="main" key="cerri_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cerrītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>contr. from cĕrĕbrītus, from cerebrum; cf. cerebrosus</etym>, <sense id="n7575.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having a crazed brain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frantic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cerritus furiosus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=54" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 54</bibl></cit> Müll. (rare and only <usg type="style">poet.</usg>), Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 44, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 2, 144</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 67</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:278" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 278</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cerrones: <entryFree id="n7576" type="gloss" key="cerrones"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cerrones</orth>, v. gerrones.</entryFree>
cerrus: <entryFree id="n7577" type="main" key="cerrus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cerrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n7577.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of oak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Turkey oak</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:9:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 9, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 5, 6, § 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:19" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 6, 8, § 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 9, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Febr. 18, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
certabundus: <entryFree id="n7578" type="hapax" key="certa_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">certābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. certo</etym>, <sense id="n7578.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">contending</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disputing</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 288, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
certamen: <entryFree id="n7579" type="main" key="certa_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">certāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n7579.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a contest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">struggle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strife</hi>, whether friendly or hostile, physical or intellectual; most freq. of a pugilistic contest of any kind; but also of contention in war. </sense><sense id="n7579.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A contest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">struggle</hi> in games or otherwise. </sense><sense id="n7579.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">videmusne apud quos eorum ludorum, qui gymnici nominantur, magnus honos sit, nullum ab iis, qui in id certamen descendant, devitari dolorem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:26:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 26, 62</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:78:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 78, 317</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hac celebrata tenus sancto certamina patri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:603" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 603</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:446" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 446</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">luctandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saliendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">citharoedorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:8:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 8, 7</bibl></cit> Spald.: <cit><quote lang="la">quinquennale triplex, musicum, gymnicum, equestre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bijugum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadrigarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:304" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 304</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:792" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 792</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">10, 560: disci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:177" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Veneris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 10, 29</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n7579.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the object contended for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the prize</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 129</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecoris magistris Velocis jaculi certamina ponit in ulmo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:530" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 530</bibl></cit> Heyne.—</sense><sense id="n7579.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a rivalry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">struggle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">emulation</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">certamen honestum (Stoicorum et Peripateticorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:21:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 21, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est mihi tecum pro aris et focis certamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:40:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 40, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est alicui certamen cum aliquo de principatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 6, 3</bibl></cit>: certamen honoris et gloriae. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:10:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 10, 34</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:12:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 12, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 41:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 41, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 5, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona ratio cum perditā confligit. In ejus modi certamine ac proelio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugna forensium certaminum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 12, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentiae inter juvenes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum linguaeque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:22:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 22, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laboris ac periculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:19:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 19, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiae, benevolentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:53:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 53, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonae artis ac virtutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:54:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 54, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:39:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 39, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conferendi (pecuniam),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:60:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 60, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrum animos certamen regni ac cupido versabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 17, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:31:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 31, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">leti (inter mulieres Indas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 13, 19: <cit><quote lang="la">diu magnum inter mortales certamen fuit, vine corporis an virtute animi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 1, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:37" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 37</bibl>.—Rarely with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> of adversary: <cit><quote lang="la">si in virtutis certamen venerint ( = cum virtute),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:24:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 24, 71</bibl></cit> Madv. ad loc.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mite vini,</quote> <trans><tr>a drinking bout</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:6:11" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 6, 11</bibl></cit>.—Also <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: certamina ponere, syn. with certamina instituere = <foreign lang="greek">a)gw=na protiqe/nai</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">to order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrange a fight</hi> or <hi rend="ital">contest</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 66</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 639</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:530" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 530</bibl> Wagn.—Of inanimate things: <cit><quote lang="la">Arboribusque datumst variis exinde per auras Crescendi magnum inmissis certamen habenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:787" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 787</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7579.5" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a military strife</hi>, <hi rend="ital">battle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">engagement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">combat.</hi> </sense><sense id="n7579.6" n="A" level="2"> Subject. (diff. from the objective; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">proeliam, pugna, bellum, etc.): horrida Romuleum certamina pango duellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:1:1" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Ann. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 476</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6</bibl>; 5, 1295; Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 18, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:844" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 844</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 180</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:19:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 19, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeterno certamine proelia pugnasque edere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fit proelium acri certamine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:28" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 28</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">proelii certamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Alex. 16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> B. Alex. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certamine,</quote> <trans><tr>with zeal</tr>, <tr>emulously</tr>, <tr>earnestly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 197</bibl></cit>; Curt. <pb n="320" /> <cb n="CERT" /> 9, 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:536" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 536</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec magni certaminis ea dimicatio fuit,</quote> <trans><tr>not severe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:60:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 60, 7</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n7579.7" n="B" level="2"> Object., = proelium, pugna, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">vario certamine pugnatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat in celeritate omne positum certamen, utri, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella atque certamina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 33:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 33, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi res ad certamen venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in certamine ipso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:44:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 44, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navalia,</quote> <trans><tr>a naval engagement</tr>, <tr>sea-fight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 14, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:85:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 85, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saevit medio in certamine Mavors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:700" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 700</bibl></cit> et saep.—Hence. </sense><sense id="n7579.8" n="C" level="2"> In the postAug. histt. for <hi rend="ital">war</hi> in gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:20" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 1, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:2:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 7, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:6:6" default="NO">7, 6, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
certatim: <entryFree id="n7580" type="main" key="certa_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">certātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>certatus, 2. certo</etym>, <sense id="n7580.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">emulously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">earnestly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eagerly</hi> (class. in prose and poetry): <cit><quote lang="la">certatim de alicujus salute dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:34:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 34, 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:54:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 54, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulieres puerique saxa et alia... certatim mittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 67:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 67, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certatim alter alteri obstrepere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:40:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 40, 6</bibl></cit>: hoc Cicero atque Asinius certatim sunt usi, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">currere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:46:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 46, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ascendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:44:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 44, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsurgere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erumpere curiā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 7</bibl></cit>: amare aliquem, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 9, 5</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:100" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 15</bibl>; and in poetry, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:392" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 392</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:385" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 385</bibl>;
