<bibl default="NO">4, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:290" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 290</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 778</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 146</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 244</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 241</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:1:179 al" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 1, 179 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
certatio: <entryFree id="n7581" type="main" key="certa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">certātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. certo</etym>, <sense id="n7581.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a contending</hi>, <hi rend="ital">striving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a combat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strife</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contest</hi>, etc. (in good prose, most freq. in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n7581.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n7581.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">jam ludi publici sint corporum certatione, cursu, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:15:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 15, 38</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 9, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">certationes xysticorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7581.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a military contest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a fight</hi> (very rare), Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 196, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7581.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: Medea nequaquam istuc istac ibit: magna inest certatio, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:25:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 25, 65</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 304 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">relinquitur non mihi cum Torquato sed virtuti cum voluptate certatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:14:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 14, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec inter eos (amicos) fit honesta certatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:9:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 9, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenia exercere certationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—Of a judicial contest: <cit><quote lang="la">haec est iniqua certatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 22, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non par,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 21, 68</bibl></cit>; hence: per populum multae poenae certatio esto, Lex ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 4, 8</bibl>.—So in the lang. of political life: <cit><quote lang="la">certatio multae,</quote> <trans><tr>a public discussion concerning a punishment to be inflicted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 4, 8</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 3, 13</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
certative: <entryFree id="n7582" type="main" key="certa_ti_ve_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">certātīvē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n7582.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in order to stir up strife</hi>, <hi rend="ital">combatively</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 1, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
certator: <entryFree id="n7583" type="main" key="certa_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">certātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n7583.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a disputant</hi> (rare and post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:10:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. p. 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
certatus: <entryFree id="n7584" type="main" key="certa_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">certātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from certo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n7585" type="main" key="certa_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">certātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>2. certo</etym>, <sense id="n7585.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a contention</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fight</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:1:152" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 1, 152</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
certe: <entryFree id="n7586" type="main" key="certe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">certē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. <itype>certus</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos> B.</entryFree>
certim: <entryFree id="n7587" type="hapax" key="certim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">certim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>certus, analog. to certatim, from certatus</etym>, <sense id="n7587.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">certainly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 1:31" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 1, 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
certioro: <entryFree id="n7588" type="main" key="certi^o_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">certĭōro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>certior</etym>, = certiorem facere, <sense id="n7588.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to inform</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apprise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">show</hi> (only in jurid. Lat., and most freq. used by Ulpian), Gai 2, 190; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:6:5:section=8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 13, 6, 5, § 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:1:1" default="NO">19, 1, 1</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">certioratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:4:1:section=4" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 29, 4, 1, § 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:29:3:section=6" default="NO">43, 29, 3, § 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
certo: <entryFree id="n7589" type="main" key="certo_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">certō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. <itype>certus</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos> A.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n7590" type="main" key="certo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">certo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>cerno</etym>, <sense id="n7590.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to decide something by a contest</hi> (cf. cerno, II. C. b.); hence, <hi rend="ital">to fight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">struggle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">combat</hi>, implying great exertion, and usually a measuring of strength (class. in prose and poetry; most freq. in a trop. signif.; syn.: decerto, contendo). </sense><sense id="n7590.1" n="I" level="1"> Of a physical contest of strength; <cit><quote lang="la">mostly of battle: utrum igitur utilius Fabricio... armis cum hoste certare, an venenis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:22:87" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 22, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescentium greges Lacedaemone videmus ipsi incredibili contentione certantis pugnis, calcibus, unguibus, morsu denique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:27:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 27, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 2:41:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 2, 41, 6</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">proelio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 81:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 81, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Gallis pro salute,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 114:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 114, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de ambiguo agro bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:71:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 71, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de imperio cum populo Romano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:18:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 18, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de principatu armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 47</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">odiis etiam prope majoribus certarunt quam viribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 30</bibl></cit> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: dignus quicum certetur, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 473, 16</bibl>: <cb n="CERT" /> certatur limine in ipso Ausoniae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:355" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 355</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 313</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">die quo Bedriaci certabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā in parte rex pugnae affuit, ibi aliquamdiu certatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 74:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 74, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in cujus (amnis) transgressu multum certato pervicit Vardanes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 61</bibl>.—Mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">certata lite deorum Ambracia (for the possession of which Apollo. Diana, and Hercules contended),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:713" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 713</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certatus nobis orbis (i. e. de quo certavimus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:342" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 342</bibl></cit>; cf. II. infra.—</sense><sense id="n7590.2" n="II" level="1"> Out of the sphere of milit. operations, <hi rend="ital">to contend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">struggle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">emulate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vie with</hi>: certabant urbem Romam Remoramne vocarent, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:48:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 48, 107</bibl> (Ann. v. 85 Vahl.): haut doctis dictis certantes sed maledictis, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:10:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 10, 4</bibl> (Ann. v. 274 ib.): <cit><quote lang="la">minis mecum, minaciis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 5, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malitiā tecum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">benedictis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:prol. 20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. prol. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certare ingenio, contendere nobilitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquo dicacitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:46:172" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 46, 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officiis inter se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:31:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 31, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">certatum inter collegas maledictis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 8, 13</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">eo modo inter se duo imperatores certabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 52:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 52, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum civibus de virtute,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro sua quisque potentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 38:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 38, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contumaciā adversus contemnentes humilitatem suam nobiles certavit (Licinius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:46:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 46, 4</bibl></cit>: cum usuris fructibus praediorum, <hi rend="ital">to contend against interest</hi> (<hi rend="ital">to strive to pay interest</hi>) <hi rend="ital">with the produce of estates</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 8, 18</bibl>: cum a Cheruscis Longobardisque pro antiquo decore aut recenti libertate; <cit><quote lang="la">et contra, augendae dominationi certaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ob hircum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 220</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">joco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:12:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 12, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mero,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animis iniquis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parsimoniā et vigiliis et labore cum ultimis militum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 18, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:29 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 29 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut si nautae certarent, quis eorum potissimum gubernaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:25:87" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 25, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mos gentis est, equitare jaculari cursu cum aequalibus certare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dic mecum quo pignore certes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celeri sagittā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:485" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 485</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certemus, spinas animone ego fortius an tu Evellas agro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 4</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: hanc rem ( = de hac re), Sedigit. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:24" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 24</bibl>; cf. in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui (multae) certandae cum dies advenisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 3, 14</bibl></cit>.—With <case>dat.</case> instead of cum: <cit><quote lang="la">solus tibi certat Amyntas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:11:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 11, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 6, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 138</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:794" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 794</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7590.3" n="2" level="3"> Particularly of judicial disputations, <hi rend="ital">to contend at law</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:16:section=39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 16, § 39</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 13</bibl>, § <cit><quote lang="la">32: in centumvirali judicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:39:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 39, 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si a duumviris provocarit, provocatione certato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:26:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 26, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid se judice certes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foro si res certabitur olim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7590.4" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <hi rend="ital">to strive to do something</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to labor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endeavor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">struggle earnestly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to exert one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">certantes ad summum succedere honorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1123</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">inter se cernere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:394" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 394</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dimittere se (nubes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:509" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 509</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populum alium suorum sepelire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 1247</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phoebum superare canendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:394" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 394</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tollere (hunc) tergeminis honoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter se eruere quercum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:443" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 443</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certat quisque evadere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:4:33" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 4, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frangere fluctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:81" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 81 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:222" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 222</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:3:191" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 3, 191</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
certor: <entryFree id="n7591" type="main" key="certor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">certor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n7591.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [collat. form of 2. certo], <hi rend="ital">to strive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">struggle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contend</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 273" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 273</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 11, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
certus: <entryFree id="n7592" type="main" key="certus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">certus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>orig. <pos>P. a.</pos> from cerno; hence</etym>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n7592.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">determined</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resolved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fixed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">settled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purposed</hi>: non dubius. </sense><sense id="n7592.1" n="I" level="1"> (Acc. to cerno, II. D.) Certum est (mihi), <hi rend="ital">it is determined</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it is my</hi> (<hi rend="ital">thy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">his</hi>, etc.) <hi rend="ital">decision</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resolution</hi>, <hi rend="ital">will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">I am resolved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">I mean</hi>, etc. (mostly ante-class.; most freq. in Plaut.); with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: quorum virtuti belli Fortuna pepercit, Eorundem me libertati parcere certum est, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:12:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 12, 38</bibl> (Ann. v. 206 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">certum'st hominem eludere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi credere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 9, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 1, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 2, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 4, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:3:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 3, 1, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 6, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 138</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 5, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 3, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 108</bibl>: certum est <cb n="CERT" /> deliberatumque, quae ad causam pertinere arbitror, omnia dicere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 11, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">certum atque decretum est non dare signum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:45:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 45, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certum est igni circumdare muros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 153</bibl></cit>.—Certum'st mihi with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 94</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 1, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 154</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:33:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 33, 144</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:46:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 46, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:53 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 53 al.</bibl>—Without <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, esp. parenthet., with expression of purpose by a <hi rend="ital">fut. tense</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">certum est, malam rem potius quaeram cum lucro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certum est, jam dicam patri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certum est, ibo ad medicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">An.</hi> Certumn' est tibi? <hi rend="ital">Ly.</hi> Certum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 2, 48</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 4, 2, 33</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">pron.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">subst.: Ar.</hi> Certumne'st tibi istuc? <hi rend="ital">He.</hi> Non moriri certius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 74</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so further with istuc,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 3, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi autem abjurare certius est quam dependere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad eum senem oppugnare certum est consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae nunc sunt certa ei consilia, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certa res hanc est objurgare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 73</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:4:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 4, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 2, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7592.2" n="b" level="4"> (From the time of the Aug. poets.) <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to the person who is determined upon something, <hi rend="ital">determined</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resolved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bent.</hi> </sense><sense id="n7592.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">certa mori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:564" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 564</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 475</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">decrevitque mori): certi non cedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certa sequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:47" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 47</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7592.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (cf. Ramsh. Gr. p. 323; Zumpt, Gr. § 437, n. 1; <cit><quote lang="la">A. and S. § 213, R. 1): certus eundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:554" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 554</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:440" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 440</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">desciscendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">relinquendae vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:27" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:16:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 16, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">destinationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sceleris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7592.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">an</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec sat certa an cederet armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:480" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 480</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7592.6" n="II" level="1"> An epithet of all those objects whose existence or reality is <hi rend="ital">fixed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">determined</hi> (hence in connection with definitus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:10:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 10, 7</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">with praefinitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 14</bibl></cit>), or in respect to which there can be no doubt (hence opp. dubius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:6:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:3" default="NO">5, 12, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:3:6 al" default="NO">12, 3, 6 al.</bibl>). </sense><sense id="n7592.7" n="A" level="2"> Object. </sense><sense id="n7592.8" n="1" level="3"> Of things whose external qualities, number, etc., are invariable, <hi rend="ital">established</hi>, <hi rend="ital">settled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fixed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">particular</hi>, <hi rend="ital">specified</hi>, etc. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Arboribus primum certis gravis umbra tributa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:783" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 783</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fruges, bacae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:8:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam ad certas res conficiendas certos homines delectos ac descriptos habebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concilium in diem certam indicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with dies,</quote> <trans><tr>a fixed term</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 149, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Chabr. 3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Chabr. 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:50:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 50, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:9 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 9 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">certis diebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:329" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 329</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaerere ab judicibus cur in certa verba jurent, cur certo tempore conveniant, certo discedant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:45:132" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 45, 132</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">certum praefinitumque tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 14</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">certum statumque vectigal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia (opp. arbitraria), v. arbitrarius: finis aerumnarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 108</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:512" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 512</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:8:1091" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 1091</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 106</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signum,</quote> <trans><tr>fixed</tr>, <tr>agreed upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <trans><tr>fixed in number and quality</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniae imperabantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 32</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conviva,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a daily</tr>, <tr>constant guest</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 75</bibl></cit> Schmid: <cit><quote lang="la">ecquem tu illo certiorem nebulonem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 21, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7592.9" n="b" level="4"> But sometimes indef., like quidam, and our <hi rend="ital">certain</hi>, of things, the certainty of whose existence is given, but whose nature is not more definitely designated, or comes not into consideration (cf. aliquis): <cit><quote lang="la">Cephaloedi mensis est certus, quo mense sacerdotem maximum creari oporteat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:52:section=128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 52, § 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habet certos sui studiosos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:16:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 16, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(hunc) certis rebus imperatis regnare jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:27:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 27, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certi homines ad eam rem periti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 18, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res a certis hominibus corrupta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 11, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marcell. 6, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 4, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:61:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 61, 7</bibl>.—Hence in Quint. several times in connection with quidam and aliquis: <cit><quote lang="la">ad certas quasdam dicendi leges alligati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8</bibl></cit>, prooem. § 2; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8</bibl>, prooem. § 12; 4, 2, 28; 5, 10, 2; 5, 10, 5; 9, 4, 8; <cit><quote lang="la">11, 2, 28: aliquos compositionis certos pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 2, 13</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7</bibl>, prooem. § 4; and <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in his certos aliquos docebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:8:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 8, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7592.10" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of things whose internal moral qualities are established, fixed, can be relied upon, <hi rend="ital">sure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unerring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be depended upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">true</hi>, <hi rend="ital">faithful</hi>,<pb n="321" /> <cb n="CERT" />  etc. (so most freq. in all periods and species of composition; syn.: firmus, confirmatus, exploratus, indubitatus, manifestus al.). </sense><sense id="n7592.11" n="a" level="4"> Of persons: amicus certus in re incertā cernitur, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:17:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 17, 64</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tu ex amicis certis mi es certissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certi homines, quibus dem litteras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 7, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Alcib. 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:19:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 19, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:64:section=156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 64, § 156</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">certus enim promisit Apollo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 7, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctor (mortis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:68" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 68</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus hostem nec spe nec animo certiorem, i. e. firmiorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:35:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 35, 17</bibl></cit>: apud latera certos collocaverat, Sall. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 1, 576</bibl> (H. 1, 53 Dietsch); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 9, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per litora certos dimittam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:576" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 576</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certissimus auctor (Phoebus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:432" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 432</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7592.12" n="b" level="4"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">satis animo certo et confirmato,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 24, 77</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">pectora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 249</bibl></cit>, and certior indoles, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">promissa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parata dicendi copia et certa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:6:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 6, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6</bibl>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">9: jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 3, 6</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">jactus (telorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 37</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">in this sense certa hasta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:767" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 767</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagitta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fides segetis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 16, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> C. S. 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trames,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lar,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 58 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plana et certa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certa et clara,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 4, 1</bibl></cit> Ruhnk.; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:39:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 39, 22</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 27</bibl>.—<pos>Subst.</pos>, with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">certa maris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 81</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7592.13" n="B" level="2"> Subject., of that which is established by evidence, etc., placed beyond doubt, <hi rend="ital">certain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">true</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">established</hi> (class.; esp. freq. in <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">cum ad has suspitiones certissimae res accederent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">incerta pro certis malebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 17, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">incerta pro certis mutare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 83:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 83, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postremo certior res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certiora esse dicunt quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:5:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 5, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 11, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:35:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 35, 12</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">So.</hi> Satin hoc certum'st? <hi rend="ital">Ge.</hi> Certum: <cit><quote lang="la">hisce oculis egomet vidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam satis certumst virginem vitiatam esse?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Enn. 4, 4, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum certius tibi sit me esse Romae quam mihi te Athenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id parum certum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:35:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 35, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum de altero intellectu certum est, de altero dubium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:6:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 6, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 3, 4</bibl>: non certum traditur, with <hi rend="ital">interrog.-clause</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 8, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quicquam certi respondes mihi?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque tanto spatio certi quid esset explorari poterat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certum inveniri non potest ne ... an,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quicquam humanorum certi est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 33, 1</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Civemne? <hi rend="ital">Th.</hi> Arbitror: <cit><quote lang="la">Certum non scimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 31</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 23, 2</bibl>.—So, certum scire, <hi rend="ital">to know for a certainty</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 3, 1, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 23 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">certum habere,</quote> <trans><tr>to reckon certain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 13, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:28:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 28, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:3:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:22:5 al" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 22, 5 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">certum respondeo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 29, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognoscere, Auct. B. Alex. 53: comperire, Auct. B. Hisp. 22.—So also pro certo habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 6, 3</bibl></cit>; Matius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 15</bibl>, A <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">negare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 21, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">polliceri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:37:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 37, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">affirmare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 1, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:23:7" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 23, 7</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 3, 2</bibl> Drak.: <cit><quote lang="la">creditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coeperit esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certius cognoscere ex aliquo de aliquā re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:52:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 52, 5</bibl></cit>.—Strengthened by <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin nihil invenies magis hoc certo certius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 111</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">et hoc certo certius est et saepissime constitutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:8:10:section=14" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 42, 8, 10, § 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certo certius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Ephes. 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Vit. St. Ambros. 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 237, 27</bibl>.—In Plaut. certum or certius facere alicui, <hi rend="ital">to give certainty to one concerning any thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make him certain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 1, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 4</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n7592.14" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to the person who is made certain in reference to a thing, <hi rend="ital">certain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">certi sumus periisse omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 19, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">num quid nunc es certior?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">posteritatis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of posthumous fame</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:3:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 45:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 45, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certus de suā geniturā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">damnationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exitii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matrimonii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certi sumus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:10:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 10, 5</bibl></cit>.—In class. prose mostly in the phrase certiorem facere aliquem (de aliquā re, alicujus rei, with a foll, <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, with a <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi> or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>), <hi rend="ital">to inform</hi>, <cb n="CERT" /> <hi rend="ital">apprise one of a thing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">me certiorem face,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nos facias certiores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 5, 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti se (sc. Caesarem) de his rebus certiorem faciant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui certiorem me sui consilii fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 2</bibl></cit>, a, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesarem certiorem faciunt, sese non facile ab oppidis vim hostium prohibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciam te certiorem quid egerim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 11, 1</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> only: <cit><quote lang="la">milites certiores facit, paulisper intermitterent proelium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod crebro certior per me fias de omnibus rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 104:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 104, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar certior factus est, tres jam copiarum partes Helvetios id flumen transduxisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 12</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 21</bibl>; 1, 41; 2, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 82:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 82, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 12, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">factus certior, quae res gererentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non consulibus certioribus factis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 21, 4</bibl></cit>.—Also in <hi rend="ital">posit.</hi>, though rarely: <cit><quote lang="la">fac me certum quid tibi est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 6, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 179</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimae suorum Tam subitae matrem certam fecere ruinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:268" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 268</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos> in two forms. </sense><sense id="n7592.15" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">certō</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with certainty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">certainly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of a truth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in fact</hi>, <hi rend="ital">really</hi>, object. and subject. (cf. supra, II. A. and B.); only in the comic poets, and sometimes (most. freq. in his epistt.) in Cic., while the adverbial form certe belongs to all periods and all species of composition. The difference between them is, perhaps, merely historical; but <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>, certe, B. I. 2. <hi rend="ital">init.</hi> </sense><sense id="n7592.16" n="1" level="3"> Object.: <cit><quote lang="la">perii certo, haud arbitrario,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:5:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 5, 42</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 106</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi certo nomen Sosia'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 176</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 2, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 3, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil ita exspectare quasi certo futurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:28:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 28, 81</bibl></cit> (cf. the passage cited under certo, I. 1., from <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:7:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 7, 18</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n7592.17" n="b" level="4"> In affirm. answers: <hi rend="ital">Me.</hi> Liberum ego te jussi abire? <hi rend="ital">Mes.</hi> Certo, <hi rend="ital">yes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">certainly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 8, 9</bibl>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 9, 50</bibl>; 2, 3, 38; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 5, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 1, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7592.18" n="2" level="3"> Subject. </sense><sense id="n7592.19" n="a" level="4"> In gen. (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">certo enim ego vocem hic loquentis modo mi audire visus sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego rus abituram me esse certo decrevi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Th.</hi> Quid aīs? <hi rend="ital">Py.</hi> Atqui certo comperi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 5, 1, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7592.20" n="b" level="4"> Esp. in the formula of asseveration, certo scio, <hi rend="ital">I certainly know</hi>, <hi rend="ital">I am fully persuaded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beyond all doubt</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">certo edepol scio, me vidisse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 4, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 4, 5, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod te moleste ferre certo scio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 12, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 23, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 13, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:2:section=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 2, § 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 8, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 6, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 51, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">veniunt in mentem mihi permulta: vobis plura, certo scio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:19:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 19, 55</bibl></cit> (cf. under certe, I. 2.).—</sense><sense id="n7592.21" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">certē</orth> (class.; cf. supra, certo <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>). </sense><sense id="n7592.22" n="I" level="1"> Affirming strongly, <hi rend="ital">with certainty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">certainly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undoubtedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assuredly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">really.</hi> </sense><sense id="n7592.23" n="1" level="3"> Object.: <cit><quote lang="la">certe edepol, tu me alienabis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 243</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego quidem ab hoc certe exorabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certe hercle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 1, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 2, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quom is certe Renuntiarit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 4, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certe captus est!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 1, 1, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certe ut videamur cernere eum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:760" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 760</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si enim scit, certe illud eveniet: sin certe eveniet, nulla fortuna est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:7:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 7, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuit certe id aequum et certe exspectatum est, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:16:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 16, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea certe vera sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:35:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 35, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Catoni certe licuit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam illa perfugia certe minime sunt audienda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum se certe decessurum videret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:44:section=104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 44, § 104</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:62:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 62, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">certe hinc Romanos olim fore ductores pollicitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 234</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o dea certe,</quote> <trans><tr>a goddess surely</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 328</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postremo expellet certe vivacior heres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">placuit tibi, Delphice, certe, Dum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:543 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 543 al.</bibl></cit>— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">speculatores mittere, qui certius explorata referant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:40:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 40, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:48:3" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 48, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si reperire vocas amittere certius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:519" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 519</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 118, 1</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7592.24" n="b" level="4"> In an answer of affirmation: <cit><quote lang="la">estne ipsus an non est! Is est, Certe is est, is est profecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 65</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:5:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 5, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:54:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 54, 149</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:15:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 15, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 35, 113</bibl>; and in confirmation of a preceding fact: venerat, ut opinor, haec res in judicium. <cb n="CERU" /> Certe, <hi rend="ital">certainly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surely</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:14:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 14, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:42:144" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 42, 144</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:29:105" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 29, 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:27:91" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 27, 91</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7592.25" n="2" level="3"> Subject., mostly in the phrase certe scio, <hi rend="ital">I know to a certainty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">I am sure</hi> (acc. to Klotz ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 1, 2</bibl>, certe scio = certum est me scire, <hi rend="ital">I am fully convinced</hi>: certo scio = certum est quod scio, <hi rend="ital">my knowledge is accurate</hi>, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">certe edepol scio, si aliud quicquam est quod credam aut certo sciam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">edepol certo scio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelestiorem me hac anu certe scio Vidisse numquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 1, 1, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:12:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 12, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex litteris certe scire potuistis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 4, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 12, 12, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod iste certe statuerat ac deliberaverat non adesse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:1:section=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7592.26" n="b" level="4"> In affirm. answers: <hi rend="ital">Ar.</hi> Ain' vero? <hi rend="ital">Le.</hi> Certe, inquam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 132</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Ain'tu? <hi rend="ital">So.</hi> Certe, sic erit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 3, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7592.27" n="c" level="4"> In a subjective supposition or presumption that a thing is so, <hi rend="ital">certainly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assuredly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">doubtless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of course;</hi> Gr. <foreign lang="greek">i)/sws</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">ah nugas agis, Certe habes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 4, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si me tanti facis, quanti certe facis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 16, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 8, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 234</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:423" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 423</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:7:1" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 7, 1</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n7592.28" n="(b)" level="5"> In interrog., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 33</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7592.29" n="II" level="1"> Affirming with restriction, <hi rend="ital">yet surely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yet indeed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at least</hi>, <hi rend="ital">notwithstanding</hi> (very freq. in prose and poetry, esp. after the class. per.). </sense><sense id="n7592.30" n="A" level="2"> Alone: <cit><quote lang="la">si non ipsā re tibi istuc dolet, Simulare certe est hominis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cingitur, certe expedit se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut homines mortem vel optare incipiant, vel certe timere desistant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:49:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 49, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec... sint falsa sane, invidiosa certe non sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 32, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui... ut non referat pedem, sistet certe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 12, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res fortasse verae, certe graves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:11:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 11, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulatum unum certe plebis Romanae esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:34:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 34, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos quoniam caeli nondum dignamur honore, Quas dedimus certe terras habitare sinamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 195</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">quo quid sit beatius, mihi certe in mentem venire non potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:28:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 28, 81</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ego certe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:65" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:57" default="NO">9, 4, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">certe ego,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 31, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:19:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 19, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:840" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 840</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:5:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 5, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi certe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse certe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:4:19" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 4, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:6:22" default="NO">7, 6, 22</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7592.31" n="B" level="2"> With other particles. </sense><sense id="n7592.32" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">tamen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud certe tamen, quod jam amplexi sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 6, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:23:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 23, 84</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7592.33" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">at</hi>: quod (consilium) si non fuerit prudens, at certe ab optima fide proficiscetur, Balb. et opp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 7</bibl>, A, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:351" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 351</bibl>; cf. at II. 3.— </sense><sense id="n7592.34" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">sed</hi>: non integrā re, sed certe minus infractā, quam, etc., Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 10, 8</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:21:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 21, 56</bibl> dub. B. and K. —</sense><sense id="n7592.35" n="4" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">quidem</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi sit animus, certe quidem in te est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:29:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 29, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam volumus quidem certe senes fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 15, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">certe quidem vos estis Romani, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:22:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 22, 5</bibl></cit>. (But quidem does not belong with certe in such passages as the foll.: <cit><quote lang="la">hic quidem certe memorat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:261 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 261 al.</bibl></cit>; v. quidem; cf. also aut and vel.)</sense></entryFree>
